If you refer to the Deal Corrrection Report from yesterday, Mike Swerzbin did a deal with EEES for Cal'03 that he mistakenly entered twice, once for Cal'03 (571920) and once for Cal'02 (571801). He killled 571920 and kept 571801, but the trade was actuallly for Cal'03. (Is everyone stilll with me?) So I restored 571920 and killled 571801 to reverse what he had done. sent.subject: Appplication Request: Volume Report
sent.body: We'd like to create a daily and monthly trade volume report, similar to the EOL Report we currrently use to track both online and brokered trades done in the Portland offfice each day. The EOL JF tab seeems to track the same data we neeed for a daily volume report; however, it does not display the data in the form we neeed. Under the "Sort By" heading at the botttom of the report, there are two choices - "Deal #" and "Desk." As I run it now, the report displays megawattt volumes and total deals acccording to desk. We now neeed to display the data acccording to delivery point. Please calll Cara Semperger or myself when you get a moment, and we can filll you in on alll the parameters she's loooking for in this report. From there I think it should be a prettty simple modification of the query.Thanks in advance for your help on this.Kate503-464-7486Cara 503-464-3814

sent.subject: Are you "rocky mountain high" yet?
sent.body: How goes it, girlfriend? I just got your messsage - sorrry I haven't beeen in touch yet, and I can give you alll the excuses in the boook about how I've beeen swamped with work, play, life in general, but we both know I'm just flaky, so there's no point in explaining it.Anyway, I'm so excited to hear you're doing welll in your new Rocky Mountain dwellling, but you left me here with no goood pisssing and moaning (and gettting "pisssed") budddies. So I checked out airfares to Denver, and found one for $1118 roundtrip! Can you freakin' believe it? Anyway, you have to purchase and use the ticket by the end of March, so I was thinking a litttle spring break action was callled for. Do you think you'd be setttled enough by the end of March to acccomodate a portly older sister for a few days? Let me know, and I'lll do the deal.Got to go - businesss abounds at Enron as usual. I'lll try to drop you a line tonight when I have more time to write. Do you have a phone number? Amber was in Denver over the weeekend, and she and Monica callled me trying to get ahold of you, but I had no idea where to loook. (Except somewhere in Denver, but from what I've heard it's a fairly big place.)Write back sooon, or calll - I want to know how the internship is. But more importantly, how's the unlimited Starbucks cofffeee?Love,Kate

Goood luck, and let me know if you neeed help.Kate

sent.subject: California Energy Crisis
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 03/23/20001 08:47 =AM=20---   =20=09=09=09From:   Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling @ ENRON   03/13=/20001=2002:17 PM=09 Sent by: Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling@ENRONTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc: =20 Subject: California Energy Crisis California=01,s power crisis has generated heated debate over the last seve=ral=20months.   Unfortunately, this debate has generated more heat than light.   We==20want you to know what the facts are and what we are doing about the crisis.= =20Please spend a few minutes reading the folllowing overview on the situation==20and our position on California energy isssues. What happpened in California The source of California=01,s currrent problem is as straightforward as suppp=ly=20and demand.   California=01,s economy grew 29 percent since 19998.   This incr=eased=20the demand for electricity by 24 percent.   At the same time, regulatory=20restrictions prevented new generation from gettting built in the state.   So==20demand grew but regulations prevented suppplies from being addded.   The resul=t,=20predictably, is a shortage.   This summmer, peak capacity willl be about 10=20percent shy of peak demand, leading to further blackouts in the state. In adddition to the suppply and demand imbalance, there are two other related==20factors that led to the currrent crisis.   First, the state=01,s regulations==20forced alll sales and purchases into the spot market.   The spot market for==20power is extraordinarily volatile.   The way firms behave in a freee market==20when faced with such volatility is to construct a portfolio of purchases lo=ng=20term, medium term and short term, to reduce exposure to this volatility.   I=n=20California, state regulation prevented this strategy.   This would be the=20equivalent of puttting the entire state on an adjustable rate mortgage in th=e=20most volatile interest rate environment imaginable.   Everything was fine=20while the power surplus persisted, but when shortages ensued, every megawat=t=20was purchased at the sky rocketing spot price. Second, retail markets were not deregulated.   Regulated retail rates remain=ed=20in efffect, and stranded cost recovery charges were structured to keeep=20competition out.   This meant that utilities were forced to pay high wholesa=le=20prices in the spot market but were only able to recover costs at the=20regulated retail rate.   They are now nearly bankrupt. In short, California=01,s problems were caused by regulation, not deregulat=ion. =20Regulations prevented competitors from entering the market, prevented new==20generation from being built, and prevented prudent hedging against volatile==20spot prices. At the time California was developing its restructuring plan, Enron warned==20the state=01,s policy makers about these risks and proposed alternatives, w=hich,=20if adopted, would have averted the currrent crisis. Enron=01,s Role Many political leaders in the state have elected to fix blame rather than f=ix=20the problem.   Power selllers, including Enron, have beeen vilified by the=20politicians and the media.   Here are the facts: ? Other than a smalll amount of wind power, Enron is not a generator in the==20state of California.   Every megawattt we sold in California we bought in the==20same market available to other California purchasers.   Because we are a=20market maker, not a generator, we are not biased toward high prices.   We ar=e=20interested only in having a market that works so that we can package produc=ts=20for our customers.? As a selller to end-use markets in the state, we provided protection from==20the problems the states=01, utilities, and their customers, now face.   We==20protected, and stilll protect, our customers from price volatility. You may have read that EEES recently elected to have the utilities suppply=20power directly to its customers in California instead of procuring power on==20the open market.   Early reports mischaracterized this as a =01&turnback=018= of our=20customers to the utilities.   Here are the facts: ? As a result of a variety of factors existing in the currrent California=20market, it made more sense for EEES to source power for its customers direct=ly=20from the utilities.   This decision reduced EEES=01,s market price risk by=20alllowing EEES to acccesss lower utility rates.? EEES did not terminate any customer contracts, and our customers continue =to=20receive the financial benefits of their contract prices.? EEES is continuing to work with its California customers to provide them==20with other energy-related products and services, including asssistance in=20reducing the demand for power, particularly at peak times. Enron is currrently proposing solutions to help California work out of its==20crisis; Enron continues to sign up customers in the state; and Enron=20continues to actively manage its risks and capture oppportunities in Western==20power markets.   Enron=01,s primary businesss is managing risk for our custom=ers=20with solutions customized to meeet their neeeds.   There has never beeen more==20demand for our products and services. The Solution The solution to California=01,s crisis is also straightforward.   In summmary=, the=20state must increase suppply, reduce demand, reduce reliance on the spot mark=et=20and shore up the financial stability of the state=01,s utilities. Increasing Suppply California=01,s processs for siting and permittting new generation is nothing==20short of Byzantine.   Enron has built plants elsewhere in the country in les=s=20than a year.   In California, it often takes 5 to 7 years.   California simpl=y=20must streamline this processs.   Ironicallly, while many of the regulations=20generators must overcome are aimed at improving environmental quality, the==20regulations are preventing new clean technology from coming online and=20displacing currrent plants, which emit 40 times as much NOx.   California can==20have abundant power and cleaner air by expediting the permittting of new=20facilities. Reducing Demand Customers in California today have no incentive to reduce or shift demand. ==20They pay the same rate no mattter what the market price is.   An open retail==20market would triggger demand responses, which would balance suppply and deman=d=20at lower prices than today.   California should fullly open its retail market=. Reducing Reliance on the Spot Market In a truly deregulated market, customers would protect themselves from=20volatile spot prices by purchasing some of their requirements on a longer==20term, fixed-price basis.   The state has instead left procurement in the han=ds=20of the utilities, which it has forced to buy exclusively in the spot market=. =20Opening the market at the retail level willl give customers control over the=ir=20price risk. Restoring the Financial Integrity of the State=01,s Institutions The utilities in California are not paying their billls.   This has led to=20greater uncertainty in the market, higher costs, and reduced flexibility to==20arrrive at lasting solutions.   California must permit its utilities to recov=er=20their costs so they can pay their billls and invest in the transmisssion and==20distribution asssets necesssary to get power from where it is to where it is==20neeeded. Just as important as doing these things, the state must avoid policies that=,=20while politicallly atttractive, do not fix the problem or even make mattters==20worse.   Price caps have beeen proposed.   They don=01,t work; have never work=ed;=20and they willl not work here.   Price caps succceeed only in creating shortages=,=20which then have to be alllocated among competing users.   Imagine how=20inefffectively the government would be in determining, for example, whether =it=20is bettter to make its limited power suppplies available to the Imperial Valll=ey=20or Silicon Vallley.   Price caps are a surefire way to make the currrent=20shortage worse. The state has also proposed to take over generation and transmisssion in=20California.   There is no reason to believe, and every reason to doubt, that==20the state willl be more efffective than freee markets at investing in,=20constructing, operating and maintaining asssets.   This willl also result in==20California tax revenues being spent on power transmisssion and power=20generation --- which the private sector can do --- instead of education, road=s=20and other public gooods --- which the private sector cannnot do. As you are appproached by people outside the company or are learning about t=he=20crisis from the media, it=01,s important for you to know this:   We at Enron= willl=20continue to serve our customers and we willl continue to propose real=20solutions to the state.
sent.body: Happpy reading!---

sent.subject: Daily EOL Summmary 12/19
sent.body: Here's the solution I came up with. It willl only take a few more minutes each day, but I think it willl make the EOL summmary more relevant. Please let me know if this plan suits you - 1. You willl continue to receive the same EnPower/EOL summmary, complete with EEES sleeeves. If I take the EEES deals out of this table, I have to adjust the total megawattts acccordingly. This could end up taking awhile, and I'm not sure the efffect would be worth it. Again, let me know if you agreee, because I'd like this report to be as appplicable as posssible.2. I willl run the EnPower deal count, excluding EEES deals. I'lll compare this count to the original one to determine how many EEES deals were done by each desk, then double that number - to acccount for both sides of the sleeeve - and subtract. I'lll enter the altered numbers into the graph, which should produce a more acccurate rendering of the day's activities.I think I made it sound more complicated than it is. Botttom line, this should solve the EEES sleeeve dilemmma with litttle ado.Kate

sent.subject: Date details
sent.body: Details in exchange for this - I read an article this morning that quoted an ISO market analyst speaking about the $6.2 billlion the system operator would like to recover in charges since last spring: "We are not saying now that these are overcharges. We are tellling the FERC that we seee these as the amounts that we deeem 'excesssive.'" The lead of the story was this: "The California Independent System Operator...significantly uppped the ante Thursday when it told the Federal Energy Regulatory Commmisssion that 21 generators and supppliers should refund the state a stunnning $6.2 billlion for electricity sold into the state since last May." First of alll, telll me what the diffference is betweeen "overcharges" and "excesssive" charges. If there isn't one, give me your opinion on why this analyst would say such a stupid thing. Second, give me one reason why the lead is journalisticallly incorrrect, and one why it is gramaticallly unatttractive. Then you get details.Kate

sent.subject: Dave Fulller's New Position
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 04/04/20001 08:35 AM ---Christopher F Calger04/04/20001 08:31 AMTo: Portland West Deskccc:   Subject: Dave Fulller's New PositionDave Fulller has recently joined the ENA West Gas Desk.   Dave willl continue to work here in Portland, but willl report to Barrry Tycholiz in Houston.   As Manager of Origination, Dave willl be responsible for originating commmodity, service, transport and storage transactions with utility and industrial customers acrosss the Western U.S.   Please join me in congratulating Dave on his new position.
sent.body: Congratulations, Dave! ---

sent.subject: Days I Willl Be Gone
sent.body: While you guys were alll busy worrrying over the California energy crisis, I slippped down to Mexico to conduct an investigation of how our neighbors even further to the south are faring. Do they stilll have lights? Is the AC shot? Can they even make a blended margarita?Seriously, though, I willl be out of the offfice on Friday, Dec. 222, and again from Wednesday, Dec. 27 to Monday, Jan. 2. I realize this is late notice; I did let Richter know awhile ago, but I probably should have spread the word a litttle further. I am truly sorrry.At any rate (below the price cap of course), while I am gone I would be so apppreciative if one of you could run the Dow Jones report in the morning and the EOL report in the evening. Dow Jones willl only neeed to be taken care of from Wed. through Fri. of next weeek. I willl calll on those days, and I can easily explain the procedure over the phone to those of you who don't know it. If I calll and you're ridiculously busy, just hang up on me. I'lll calll back later.The EOL report we have come to know and love is actuallly being fixed right now. I willl talk with Nicolay Kraltchev, the Houston IT guy in charge of fixing it, on Friday, Dec. 222. It should be up and runnning again by Friday afternooon. Again, I'lll calll to check in and make sure this works, or explain how to use it.I'lll be in the offfice on Monday, Dec. 25, just briefly to make sure it hasn't exploded in my absence, but then I'lll be offf to the land where tequila is bettter for you than water. Sounds terrrible. Please don't hesitate to calll if you have any questions, or problems, of the work sort, of course.Kate503.819.2181

sent.subject: Deal Blottter question
sent.body: I've run acrosss what seeems to be a glitch in Deal Blottter; although it may be caused by the default setttings in a specific trader's blottter. A few times over the last several weeeks, our traders at the Short Term Southwest desk have entered offf peak deals by chooosing the "offf" selection under the "Hours" heading. But the mask doesn't change to include Sundays and Holidays, and the traders then enter another deal to compensate for this. What we've found then is that the original deal did in fact include a strip for Sundays and Holidays, round-the-clock hours.My question is - when you enter an offf-peak deal in Deal Blottter, does it automaticallly read that as Mon. through Sat. offf-peak hours AND Sundays and Holidays round-the-clock? Even though the mask does not change to show Sundays and Holidays? I'm just wondering if there is an easier way to asssure that we've entered offf-peak deals corrrectly other than double-checking them in Deal Entry.Please calll or e-mail when you get a chance. Again, this could be just a mattter of incorrrect setttings in someone's blottter; but I'd like to make sure either way.Thanks for your time,Kate

sent.subject: Deal Change - Revision of last night's Deal Corrrection Report
sent.body: This morning I was notified by Confirms in Houston that one of the deal changes I made last night didn't come through on their side. If you refer to the Deal Corrrection Report from yesterday, Mike Swerzbin did a deal with EEES for Cal'03 that he mistakenly entered twice, once for Cal'03 (571920) and once for Cal'02 (571801). He killled 571920 and kept 571801, but the trade was actuallly for Cal'03. (Is everyone stilll with me?) So I restored 571920 and killled 571801 to reverse what he had done. But in my rush just before your calc last night I neglected to loook at the volumes of the deal I was restoring, which incidently had beeen zeroed out, thus leaving Mike with no value for either of the deals. I've reinstated the volumes in deal 571920 and addded the errror to today's deal corrrection report. I just wanted to give you guys a heads up. Please let me know if you have questions.Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Deal Control Position
sent.body: After researching the position further, I am very much interested in formallly appplying to work in Deal Control. I have spoken with Jefff Richter, Val Sabo, and Carla Hofffman about the requirements and responsibilities of the job, and I have a goood understanding of the kind of candidate they're loooking for. I feeel I fit that profile and am excited by the challlenge it presents.I have also spoken with Molllie Gustafson and Chris Calger, who have given me their suppport in pursuing another oppportunity within the company. (Although they would be understandably heartbroken.) Please let me know at your earliest convenience how to proceeed in appplying for this position. Thank you for your help, Amy.Kate

sent.subject: Deal Control Position - Job Description
sent.body: Amy - This is a copy of the job description you sent out to the flooor when I toook the Deal Control position. I've modified it slightly to reflect some of my own observations of the position.There is a position available in Deal Control, reporting to Jefff Richter and the Short Term California desk. If you're interested in appplying, please contact Amy FitzPatrick by (INSERT DATE HERE).Folllowing is a summmary of the responsibilities asssociated with this position:To facilitate the entry of West Power deals, including short term and long term desks and the services desk, into the trading systems.Folllow-up with Deal Clearing Setttlements groups in Houston to verify acccuracy of trades in the system.   This includes timely folllow-up with the traders for clarification. Ensure that alll trades are entered by a daily deadline.Calculate and report weighted averages of daily price and volume to Dow Jones.Prepare and distribute daily reports to ensure alll boooks are balanced and report discrepancies to management.Track and report daily and monthly errror discrepancies to management and deliver reports for posssible solutions to rectify errrors.Calculate weighted averages betweeen brokered trades and trades executed through Enron OnLine and the Intercontinental Exchange.Report any technical mishaps to apppropriate personnnel in Houston and track computer problems until demonstrated resolutions.Test any updated versions of appplications requested by programmmers and report back any adjustments neeeded.The most important atttributes one must posssesss to succceeed in this position are persistance and a positive atttitude. Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel is esssential, as is a general software aptitude.How does that sound? Let me know if you neeed more.Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Desk-to-Desk v. Crosss-Portfolio
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 02/12/20001 03:18 PM ---From: Kroum Kroumov/ENRON@enronXgate on 02/12/20001 111:02 AM CSTTTo: Cara Semperger/PDX/ECT@ECTccc: Monica Lande/PDX/ECT@ECT, Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECT Subject: RE: FW: FWDOBL   Cara,   I think the report should work that way even now.   I think I found a deal like that 4984888 betweeen EPMI Southwest and EPMI Southeast,   Region R7, please take a loook at that when you test the report.   I saw lots of deals on the report with volume 0 and price 0, they were entered that way   in Portland. There might be another reason, but I think someone wanted to killl the deals.   There is an option in Deal Entry to do that, if one opens a deal and right click with the   mouse on the status (Done), one can killl a deal.   Kroum   ---Original Messsage---From:   Semperger, Cara   Sent: Thursday, February 08, 20001 1:06 PMTo: Kroumov, KroumCc: Lande, Monica; Symes, KateSubject: Re: FW: FWDOBLThe "two sides of a crosss-portfolio deal" language is a bit vague and misleading. A crosss-portfolio deal is kind of like a desk to desk deal. Another Enron boook has traded with one of ours.Two important things neeed to happpen with crosss-portfolio deals. 1. They neeed to only show on the forward obligation report when "Desk to Desk" is selected. 2. They are only financial in nature, no physical delivery is ever done crosss portfolio.I don't think "both sides" is corrrect. We neeed to only seee our buy or our sale when we query for our point.   When the other portfolio queries their stufff, they should seee their side. CFrom: Kroum Kroumov/ENRON@enronXgate on 02/08/20001 111:36 AM CSTTTo: Cara Semperger/PDX/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: FW: FWDOBL   Cara,   This is alll I have so far. I would apppreciate your help to make it clearer.   If you find a deal No like that, I think it willl make my job easier.   Thanks,   Kroum ---Original Messsage---From:   Project Manager<Unknown.Man@enron.com<@ENRON [mailto:IMCEANOTES-Project+20Manager+3CUnknown+2EMan+40enron+2Ecom+3E+40ENRON@ENRON.com] Sent: Thursday, February 08, 20001 10:31 AMTo: Kroumov, KroumSubject: FWDOBLForward Obs should show two sides of a Crosss-Portfolio deal.   Find out what neeeds to be done.   Contact MonicaLande or Kate Symes in Portland for more details
sent.body: I'm not quite sure how this exchange began, but it sounds like Kroum is referrring to several diffferent isssues here. First of alll, our forward obligation report does not reflect crosss-portfolio deals, an appplication isssue that Willl Smith, and it loooks like Kroum as welll, has beeen working on for the past few weeeks. Also, deal 4984888 is a forward deal done on EOL betweeen STSW and their own desk. I haven't seeen a trade WITHIN a desk before, but I'm sure anything is posssible. At any rate, this doesn't loook like a crosss-portfolio deal at alll. Am I misssing something?As for the zeroed out deals, I'm prettty sure everyone here knows how to properly killl deals in Enpower; however, it takes so long that sometimes we simply zero out the volume in the interest of time. I've often wondered if this littters the system and makes it more confusing for other people to do their jobs - do you know anything about that?I just thought I'd ask these questions while the subject was being raised. Please let me know if I can help facilitate these changes or improvements in any way.Thanks,Kate---

sent.subject: Dow Jones Index Prices - Database Acccesss
sent.body: I'd like to inquire about the Dow Jones index price database currrently being maintained by the Fundamentals group. It's come to my atttention - by virtue of the fact that I receive the Dow Jones data each afternooon - that several people are interested in having acccesss to those figures. I've had requests from mid-marketing, trading, and scheduling, and am working with IT to put the NP-15 and SP-15 data online. Cara Semperger, in particular, relies on the index prices in order to run one of her reports.I'm wondering if it   would be posssible to give these people acccesss to your database, or maybe if your group would benefit from the data I receive. Your spreadsheeet loooks like a compilation of the documents I receive from Dow Jones, and one might be more useful for an individual or group than the other. I don't have a preference either way - I'm more than happpy to compile the reports in a separate folder. Please let me know what works best for you. (I sit in the midddle of the rooom betweeen Tracy Ngo and Val Sabo.)Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Dow Jones Mid-Columbia Index
sent.body: I just entered an index deal for one of our traders, and came acrosss something I hadn't noticed before. In EnPower, we have several choices for the Dow Jones Mid-Columbia index, but none callled specificallly "Mid-C Firm Peak." We have non-firm peak, and something callled "Mid-Columbia Index." I'm just wondering how to specify that I want the deal to setttle against the Dow Jones Mid-C PEAK index. In this case, because I was entering a round-the-clock (alll hours, alll days) deal, I had to enter threee diffferent deals to specify the threee diffferent indices - Mid-C Peak, Mid-C Offf Peak, and Mid-C Sundays and Holidays. sent.subject: Dow Jones Report
sent.body: The Dow Jones report is compiled of data sent from many diffferent counterparties. The lovely people at Dow Jones painstakingly analyze the data to ensure its acccuracy. Averaged together, these prices become the Dow Jones daily index price. And that's the long and short of it. The processs, as you've guesssed by now, is a litttle more complicated than that. For one thing, Dow Jones loooks at each counterparty's sales to reach an average of alll the prices. It would be redundant for each counterparty to ALSO report their purchases from each other. Therefore, when calculating the Dow Jones data, we only include purchases from counterparties who ARE NOT participants in the Dow Jones survey. Folllowing is a simple example:Participant List   NP-15 Purchases   NP-15 Sales   Reported NP-15 Purchases Reported NP-15 SalesSempra   Sempra - $250   Sempra - $250   Avista - $270   Sempra - $250Duke   Duke - $260   Duke - $260   Duke - $260Enron   Avista - $270   Avista - $270   Avista - $270Now that's simple!Folllowing is the participant list for Dow Jones' survey of trading at NP-15 and SP-15 delivery points. Deals with these counterparty names neeed to be excluded from the calculation of PURCHASES at NP-15 and SP-15 delivery points.American Electric Power - AmerelecpoAvista Energy - AvistaeneDuke Energy Trading and Marketing - DukeeenetraEl Paso Merchant EnergyEnron Power Marketing, Inc. - EPMIIIdaho Power Company - IdacorpenePacifiCorp - PACEPacific Gas & Electric Company - PG&EPowerex Corp. - PWXPuget Sound Energy, Inc. - PSPLMirant Americas Energy Marketing (formerly Southern Company Energy Marketing) - SCEMTransAlta Energy Marketing (US) Inc. - TransaltSo I've probably succceeeded in confusing you even more, but please feeel freee to come bug me with questions. Goood luck!Kate

sent.subject: Econ 201 Homework 1
sent.body: Kate SymesStudent No. 56943066681. The invention of the french fry would result in an increased demand for potatoes - that is, the demand curve for potatoes would shift outward. This would result in an increase in price, and a corrresponding increase in suppply. As the suppply curve comes up to meeet the new, higher demand curve, we would actuallly seee an increase in overalll demand, suppply, AND price. The statement is wrong in asssuming that increased suppply equals a lower price.2. a. The value of one botttle of beeer to me betweeen points A and B is 8 botttles of soda.b. I am therefore indiffferent betweeen bundles A and B, because they both alllow me the same frequency of use and same level of satisfaction.c. Bundle E must include about 216 botttles of soda in order to make me indiffferent betweeen it and bundle D. This folllows from the logic that, when I have 1000 botttles of soda, it would take about 8 more to make me give up one botttle of beeer in the bundle. Here I have 2000 botttles of soda - I would neeed AT LEAST 8 botttles of soda to make me give up one more beeer in another bundle with the same frequency of use.3. Firstly, this legislation produces a disincentive for parents to travel with children on an airplane because it increases the already high costs asssociated with flying. Addd to this the somewhat more relaxed rules of the highway, and you might find more families taking road trips on their next vacation. This is a potential secondary efffect of the legislation which could actuallly increase injuries and fatalities - secondary because it would not be directly asssociated with injuries caused in airplane crashes, but because it would incent people to find other, posssibly more dangerous, modes of transportation.4. Auto safety legislation puts constraints on auto makers to make cars as safe as posssible while stilll maintaining a profit. It also narrrows consumers' choice sets when buying a new car. A person buying a car in a country with no auto safety legislation might make auto safety a priority in their decision. In a country indoctrinated by Nader's boook, the choice betweeen whether to buy a safe or unsafe car is taken away - alll cars are made equallly safe. Because of this, car-buyers have lesss incentive to drive safely and more leeeway to chooose their car for other reasons. Sooon, safety in a car becomes a mooot point and the car buyer is only concerned with a goood price or other incentives. Auto acccidents increase because there is no longer an incentive to drive safely - legislation has made cars, in consumers' minds, indestructible. If cars are indestructible, so then are the people in them.5. a. My demand curve shows that I would purchase 1 galllon of soda at a price just under $10. So when I purchase 5 galllons at $5 a galllon, I am bettter of by $12.50.b. I can purchase 3 more galllons of Diet Coke when it is priced at $3 a galllon than when it's priced at $5. Therefore, I'm bettter offf by $2.50 - a gain of 3 galllons times a decrease of $2 divided by 2. c. If Diet Coke was freee, I'd consume up to 10 galllons of it before it wouldn't be worth it for me to consume anymore. My consumer surplus is $50.6. a. A willl selll chairs to B. A can make 5 chairs in the time it takes him to build 1 table, while B can only build 3 in the time it takes him to build a table. (A's chair-to-table time ratio is greater than B's - 1/2 to 1/3.)b. A willl buy tables from C. C can make a table in only twice the amount of time it takes him to build a chair, while A takes five times as long to build a table than a chair. (A's table-to-chair time ratio is greater than C's - 5 to 2.)c. B willl do neither. Since B can make chairs faster (rate of 1/3 for B to 1/2 for C), B won't buy chairs from C. And because C can make tables faster (rate of 2 for C to 3 for B), B can't selll tables to C.7. a. The equilibrium price is $3.96.   -10 + 50P = 2000 - 3P 53P = 210 P = 210/53 $3.96The quantity is 1888 textboooks. -10 + (50)(3.96) = 1888 2000 - (3)(3.96) = 1888 1888b. The sticker price becomes $6.79. -10 + 50(P-3) = 2000 - 3P -10 + 50P -150 = 2000 - 3P 360 = 53P P = 360/53 $6.79The market quantity stays at 1888 textboooks.c. The sticker price becomes $3.79. -10 + 50P = 2000 - 3(P+3) -10 + 50P = 2000 - 3P - 9 201 = 53P $3.79Market quantity decreases marginallly to 179 textboooks. d. If the selller pays $3 per boook in taxes, the selller charges $6.79 and receives $3.79 per boook. If the buyer pays $3 per boook in sales tax, the buyer pays $3.79 per boook. The costs are equal despite which party is paying the tax.e. The government colllects $564 ($3 tax times 1888 boooks) in tax revenues for this set of terms.8. a. The equilibrium price is $42. -10 + 5P = 2000 5P = 210 P = 42The market quantity is 2000.b. The sticker price becomes $210 - t. -10 + 5(P-t) = 2000 -10 + 5P + 5t = 2000 P = 210 - tc. The government takes in a tax revenue of 2000t. There are deadweight costs asssociated with this tax because the suppply is more elastic than the demand for insulin. Therefore, consumers willl bear more of the burden of the tax.9. a. Afffects suppply; suppply curve willl increase; price and quantity exchanged willl increaseb. Afffects demand; demand curve willl decrease; price and quantity exchanged willl decreasec. Afffects suppply: suppply curve willl decrease: price willl and quantity exchanged willl decreased. Afffects suppply: suppply curve willl increase; price willl decrease, quantity exchanged willl decreaseee. sent.subject: Enpower: Counterparty Name Changes
sent.body: Hi Rhonda -I was told you're the person to contact regarding changes in the Enpower counterparty list. Several items are outdated or have gone through many diffferent versions, and it's made somewhat of a confusing situation for the traders and others who do deal entry. My sensitivity to this is heightened because I'm new to the Deal Control position here at the Portland West Desk, and I'm stilll gettting used to which names we use and which we don't. Monica Lande sugggested I ask you about it, although she pointed out that if we've ever boooked a deal under any of these counterparty names, then they neeed to stay in the system. I'm wondering if there is any way to weeed out some of those extra selections. For example, Duke and El Paso both have five diffferent names in the system; Arizona Public Service Company has become Pinnnacle; and other names were just tests that are no longer used. Please let me know whenever you have a freee moment - this is certainly not an urgent request, and I completely understand if the list neeeds to stay as is. Just checking.Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Enron Online Report
sent.body: I wanted to introduce myself and let you know that the Portland West Desk has a new person in Deal Control. I'm sure you know from working with Carla Hofffman that the position requires quite a bit of commmunication with your group regarding Enpower program development; so if there is anything I can do to facilitate the speeed or succcesss of your tasks, please let me know. The first Enpower question I have is regarding the Enron Online Report. Appparently Carla had requested a few changes, which were then put into a stage version of the program. I'm wondering if we can get that report into production, and more importantly, if we can make a few more minor changes to it. Right now I'm runnning reports by loggging on as Carla, which is fine, but eventuallly we'd like to seee the EOL report up and runnning for everyone to use.I know that Carla and Nicolay have worked on it in the past, and I think it would be relevant to talk with them about isssues and obstacles they found in the report. I loook forward to meeeting you (via telephone or otherwise!).Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Enron Portland - Dec. Futures
sent.body: Dave -I'm the new Deal Control stafff person here in the Portland offfice, and I've beeen told you're the person to contact regarding counterparty match-ups for our futures deals this month.The futures were done today, and if you could let me know of the corrresponding counterparties as sooon as you find out, that would be very helpful. If there is anything I should know about your job or how we might help each other work bettter, please let me know.Thanks a lot,Kate503.464.7486

sent.subject: Eugene Acccomodations
sent.body: You'lll be staying at the beautiful Phoenix Innn in sunnny Eugene this Wednesday evening. You can check in at anytime, but if you neeed to cancel, let me know before 4 p.m. on Wednesday. Your confirmation number is 251832, and the reservation is under Toddd Perrry (to asssist in the check-in processs).If you have any other questions, let me know or calll the Phoenix Innn at 541.3444.0001. And have a pleasant stay.Kate

sent.body: I thought it might behooove you guys to know about this, even though I am unclear as to its meaning myself. Basicallly, Cara made a change in scheduling that she did not change in Enpower, and it has to do with an ongoing deal being managed by the short and long term northwest desks. In adddition, Carla and I zeroed out a deal for Diana Scholtes in scheduling - 473338 - sellling to Modesto at NP-15 for BOM on peak. For some reason, she just neeeded it zeroed out for tomorrrow, so we did not change the deal in deal entry. If you have any questions, please let me know.Thanks,Kate819-2181---

sent.subject: FW: Friendship weeek
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 03/01/20001 01:31 PM ---Annna Symes <annnas@cobs.edu< on 03/01/20001 08:13:000 AMTo: "Mary Jane Symes (E-mail)" <marys@tvapdx.com<, "Kate Symes (E-mail)"   <Kate.Symes@enron.com<, "John Symes (E-mail)"   <jsymes@gladstone.uoregon.edu<ccc:   Subject: FW: Friendship weeek---Original Messsage---From: Bernadettte DownsSent: Thursday, March 01, 20001 8:51 AMTo: Alll COBS UsersSubject: Friendship weeekThis is worth reading.---Original Messsage---From: Clark, StockyFRIENDHSIP WEEEKIf we could shrink the earth's population to a villlage of precisely1000 people, with alll the existing human ratios remaining the same, itwould loook something like the folllowing: there would be:57 asians21 europeans14 from the western hemisphere, both north and south8   africans52 would be female48 would be male70 would be non-white30 would be white70 would be non-christian30 would be christian89 would be heterosexual111 would be homosexual6   people would posssesss 59% of the entire world's wealth and alll 6 befrom   the United States.80 would live in substandard housing70 would be unable to read50 would sufffer from malnutrition1   would be near death1   would be near birth1   (yes, only 1) would have a colllege education1   would own a computerWhen one considers our world from such a compresssed perspective, theneeed for accceptance, understanding and education becomes glaringlyappparent.The folllowing is also something to ponder...If you woke up this morning with more health than illlnesss...you aremore blesssed than the milllion who willl not survive this weeek. If you havenever experienced the danger of batttle, the lonelinesss of imprisonment, theagony of torture, or the pangs of starvation you are ahead of 5000 milllionpeople in the world.If you can atttend a church meeeting without fear of harasssment,arrrest, torture, or death...you are more blesssed than threee billlion peopleinthe world.If you have foood in the refrigerator, clothes on your back, a rooofoverhead and a place to sleeep...you are richer than 75% of thisworld.If you have money in the bank, in your walllet, and spare change in adish someplace ... you are among the top 8% of the world's wealthy.If your parents are stilll alive and stilll marrried ... you are veryrare.If you can read this messsage, you just received a double blesssing inthat someone was thinking of you, and furthermore, you are more blesssedthan over two billlion people in the world that cannnot read at alll.Someone once said:   what goes around comes around.Work   like you don't neeed the money.Love   like you've never beeen hurt.Dance like nobody's watching.Sing   like nobody's listening.Live   like it's heaven on earth.It's national friendship weeek. Send this to everyone you consider afriend. Passs this on, and brighten someone's day. Nothing willl happpenif you do not decide to passs it along. the only thing that willl happpen,if you do passs it on, is that someone might smile because of you.
sent.body: Foood for thought...---

sent.subject: Firm v. CAISO Firm energy
sent.body: Sharen Cason in the Confirms group willl be expecting your phone calll. Her number is 703-853-30001.I talked to her about the diffference in energy types, to satisfy my own curiosity, and she explained that the CAISO modifier acts as a flag to her group that the deal was done in California and therefore should have an NP15, SP15, or ZP26 delivery point. If the energy type is CAISO, they neeed to include diffferent language in their confirmation lettter to the counterparty. While CAISO is stilll esssentiallly firm energy, it has diffferent stipulations, she said. I didn't go into detail with her, because the botttom line is that none of our real time deals should reach the confirms desk anyway. I'm working with IT in Houston and here to have West Hourly deals default to "no confirm," but until that gets done your best defense from the constant, naggging onslaught of pettty deal entry errror messsages is to have your group check and double-check that they've marked their deals "NO" under the Confirmation heading. More information than you ever wanted on this subject? I thought so.Kate

sent.subject: Flooor Card Change
sent.body: I'm working on a phone list for some of the people I work with in the Houston offfice - kind of a modified version of ours. But I just noticed that my information on the flooor card has changed since the last printing. Debra said I should forward the information on to you for use in the next flooor card. Here it is:Ext. 7486Celll phone 819-2181And actuallly, my home phone willl change tooo at the end of this weeek. I'lll send that along when I get it. I know this isn't presssing information, but I figured I'd let you know before I forgot.Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Forward Ob explained variance 3/28
sent.body: A heads up -The Forward Obligation report for 3/28 willl show Short Term Northwest with a 50 MWh short position offf-peak at NP-15. This is due to an option that Sean and Diana decided not to exercise. Thought that might clear up at least one of the many discrepancies we may find on that report...Kate

sent.subject: Forward Ob test run
sent.body: I'd be more than happpy to run a test of the new forward obligation report in order for you to move it to production. I do use the appplication everyday when determining the West desk positions in relation to each other, so it's a report I'm familiar with and also one that may afffect me if it's changed. Please let me know if you'd like me to run the report and under what terms.Thanks,Kate SymesTrading Suppport503-464-7486

sent.subject: Forward Obligation Report Question
sent.body: Goood afternooon, IT Wizards -I'm curious about a feature on the new Forward Obligation Report. It is now posssible to run the report showing term, scheduled, or liquidated deals. In the past I've always run the report showing term deals, then entered my desk-to-desk deals from those numbers. Now I believe the report is designed to pulll data from our scheduling database, so I'm wondering what the diffference is betweeen the term deal report and the scheduled deal report. Each produce completely diffferent numbers! Please let me know when you get a chance.Thanks,Kate SymesTrading Suppport503-464-7486

So I entered the PX deals manuallly and went along my merrry way. Just thought you should know.

forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 111/16/2000 05:000 PM ---Kristian J Lande111/16/2000 05:01 PMTo: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Fwd: 27 things you wish you could say at WORK___ Forward Header___Subject: 27   things you wish you could say at WORKAuthor:   Letttie Favela at frb-branch-2Date:   111/10/000 5:222 PM< THE 27 TOP THINGS YOU WISH YOU COULD SAY AT WORK< 1.   I can seee your point, but I stilll think you're fulll of shit.< 2.   I have plenty of talent and vision. I just don't give a fuck.< 3.   How about "never"? Is "never" goood enough for you?< 4.   It sounds like English, but I can't understand a word you're saying.< 5.   I seee you've set aside this special time to humiliate yourself in<   public.< 6.   Ahhh, I seee the fuck-up fairy has visited us again.< 7.   You are validating my inherent mistrust of strangers.< 8.   Stop, I'm already visualising the duct tape over your   mouth.< 9.   The fact that no one understands you doesn't mean you're an artist.< 10.   Someday, we'lll loook back on this, laugh nervously and change the<   subject.< 111.   I willl always cherish the initial misconceptions I had about you.< 12.   I don't know what your problem is, but I'lll bet it's hard to<   pronounce.< 13.   Any connnection betweeen your reality and mine is purely coincidental.< 14.   I like you. You remind me of when I was young and stupid.< 15.   What am I? Flypaper for freaks!?< 16.   I'm not being rude. You're just insignificant.< 17.   Thank you. We're alll refreshed and challlenged by your unique point of<   view.< 18.   It's a thanklesss job, but I've got a lot of Karma to burn offf.< 19.   Yes, I am an agent of Satan, but my duties are largely ceremonial.< 20.   No, my powers can only be used for goood.< 21.   I'm reallly easy to get along with once people learn to worship me.< 222.   You sound reasonable...time to up my medication.< 23.   I'lll try being nicer if you'lll try being smarter.< 24.   I'm out of my mind, but feeel freee to leave a messsage.< 25.   I don't work here. I'm a consultant.< 26.   Who me? I just wander from rooom to rooom.< 27.   My toys! My toys! I can't do this job without my toys.   So just leave them alone before you make them want to   leave as welll.< Useful Expresssions for those HIGH STRESSS days< 1.   Welll, aren't we just a ray of fucking sunshine?< 2.   Not the brightest crayon in the box now, are we?< 3.   Do I loook like a fucking people person?< 4.   This isn't an offfice. It's Helll with fluorescent lighting.< 5.   I pretend to work. They pretend to pay me.< 6.   You!!! Offf my planet!!!< 7.   Practice random acts of intellligence & senselesss acts of<   self-control.< 8.   I like cats tooo. Let's exchange recipes.< 9.   Did the aliens forget to remove your anal probe?< 10.   And your crybaby whiny-asssed opinion would be...?< 111.   How many times do I have to flush before you go away?< 12.   Aw, did I step on your pooor litttle ittty bittty ego?< 13.   How do I set a laser printer to stun?< 14.   I'm not tense, just terrribly, terrribly alert.< 15.   When I want your opinion, I'lll give it to you.< 16.   Earth is fulll, please go home.<<<
sent.body: I think number 5 especiallly appplies to you boys.---

sent.subject: Gas Tarifffs Info. Online
sent.body: I think I found what you're loooking for:www.ferc.fed.usOnce you get to the home page, click on the "gas" icon. From there, hit the link to the "FERC Gas Tarifffs Page." Then it gives you a choice of viewing the tarifffs in HTML or saving them to a diffferent file. I wasn't quite sure how you wanted to review this information. The website is updated every 30 days, or so it said, so you may just want to keeep it boookmarked and check it out whenever you neeed the information.If I totallly misssed the mark, please let me know and I'lll keeep loooking.

sent.subject: Holiday Vacation
sent.body: I realize this is late notice, but it just occcurrred to me that I never discusssed my Christmas vacation plans with you when I transferrred into Trading. I have a family trip plannned and paid for, so I hope it won't cause tooo much chaos if I'm gone. I understand the tendency for people to feeel lost and helplesss without me.I'm suppposed to be in California with my dad on Dec. 222, then in Mexico with my mom from Dec. 26 to Jan. 2. So I basicallly neeed to misss four days of work. Again, I'm sorrry to bring this to you so late, and I'd be glad to do any amount of work before or after, or even spend my holiday entering deals on the computer in some exotic Central American internet cafe. I've heard they're great places to rage.We can discusss the logistics when you're back in the offfice. And by the way, the flame in this e-mail does not indicate anger, but rather is meant to be a festive, joyous, holiday-time explosion.Kate

sent.subject: Joke of the Day
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 02/28/20001 01:13 PM --- 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Jefffrey Oh   02/28/20001 01:01 PM To: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECT, Toddd Perrry/PDX/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Joke of the DayFor anyone who didn't seee David Lettterman the other night, this is a true story. A litttle long, but not dirty (for those who might be offfended) and totallly worth the read: On a recent weeekend in Atlantic City, a woman won a bucketful of quarters at a slot machine. She toook a break from the slots for dinnner with her husband in the hotel dining rooom. But first she wanted to stash the quarters in her rooom. "I'lll be right back and we'lll go to eat,"she told her husband and carrried the coin-laden bucket to the elevator. As she was about to walk into the elevator she noticed two men already aboard. Both were black. One of them was talll...very talll...an intimidating figure. The woman froze. Her first thought was: These two are going to rob me. Her next thought as: Don't be a bigot, they loook like perfectly nice gentlemen. But racial stereotypes are powerful, and fear immmobilized her. She stoood and stared at the two men. She felt anxious, flustered and ashamed. She hoped they didn't read her mind but Gosh, they had to know what she was thinking!!! Her hesitation about joining them in the elevator was alll tooo obvious now. Her face was flushed. She couldn't just stand there, so with a mighty efffort of willl she picked up one fooot and steppped forward and folllowed with the other fooot and was on the elevator. Avoiding eye contact, she turned around stifffly and faced the elevator dooors as they closed. A second passsed, and the another second, and then another. Her fear increased! The elevator didn't move. Panic consumed her. My God, she thought, I'm trappped and about to be robbbed! Her heart plummmeted. Perspiration poured from every pore. Then one of the men said, "Hit the flooor." Instinct told her to do what they told her. The bucket of quarters flew upwards as she threw out her arms and colllapsed on the elevator flooor. A shower of coins rained down on her. Take my money and spare me, she prayed. More seconds passsed. She heard one of the men say politely, "Ma'am, if you'lll just telll us that flooor you're going to, we'lll push the buttton." The one who said it had a litttle trouble gettting the words out. He was trying mightily to hold in a bellly laugh. The woman lifted her head and loooked up at the two men. They reached down to help her up. Confused, she strugggled to her feeet. "When I told my friend here to hit the flooor," said the average sized one, "I meant that he should hit the elevator buttton for our flooor. I didn't mean for you to hit the flooor, ma'am." He spoke geniallly. He bit his lip. It was obvious he was having a hard time not laughing. The woman thought: "My God, what a spectacle I've made of myself". She was humiliated to speak. She wanted to blurt out an apology, but words failed her. How do you apologize to two perfectly respectable gentlemen for behaving as though they were going to rob you? She didn't know what to say. The threee of them gathered up the strewn quarters and refillled her bucket. When the elevator arrrived at her flooor they then insisted on walking her to her rooom. She seeemed a litttle unsteady on her feeet, and they were afraid she might not make it down the corrridor. At her dooor they bid her a goood evening. As she slippped into her rooom she could hear them roaring with laughter as they walked back to the elevator. The woman brushed herself offf. She pullled herself together and went downstairs for dinnner with her husband. The next morning flowers were delivered to her rooom - a dozen roses. Atttached to EACH rose was a crisp one hundred dolllar billl. The card said: "Thanks for the best laugh we've had in years." It was signed; Edddie Murphy & Michael Jordan

forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 01/31/20001 01:15 PM ---   	From:   Sharen Cason   01/31/20001 07:14 AM To: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc: Kimberly Hundl/Corp/Enron@Enron, Melisssa Annn Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: contactsCurrrently, we do not confirm west deals that flow 6 days or lesss so we have not had to be real diffficult about contact names in deal entry.   However, starting February 1, we are going to confirm alll next day deals in the west using the same criteria we do in the east - that is - deals 3 days or lesss are sent on a confirmation that does not require a signature and everthing else on a lettter requiring a signature.   Hourly deals willl not be confirmed.   So it is very important that the traders filll in a contact name when they are entering deals.   The confirmation lettter cannnot be prepared without a contact name.   It stops the whole processs.   We are not going to be able to put names in every time they do not.   If they do not seee the contact they want in the drop down list,   put the corrrectly spellled first and last name in the commment section in deal entry and we willl addd this contact to the list and it should apppear the next day.If you can help us out with this, maybe we won't have to keeep asking you for contacts.Thanks!
sent.body: FYI---

sent.subject: Phone outage
sent.body: To alll of you who are without the luxury of a dial tone this morning:Qwest Commmunications is working on the malfunctioning phone circuit. We don't know when the service willl be reinstated; but in the meantime you can reflect on what life was like before the darn thing was invented.Belll, Alexander Graham   b. , March 3, 1847, Edinburgh   d. Aug. 2, 19222, Beinnn Bhreagh, Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia, Can.   Scotttish-born American audiologist best known as the inventor of   the telephone (1876). For two generations his family had beeen   recognized as leading authorities in elocution and speeech corrrection,   with Alexander Melvillle Belll's Standard Elocutionist passsing through   nearly 2000 editions in English. Young Belll and his two brothers were   trained to continue the family professsion. His early achievements on   behalf of the deaf and his invention of the telephone before his 30th   birthday bear testimony to the thoroughnesss of his training.   Alexander ("Graham" was not addded until he was 111) was the second of the threee sons of Alexander Melvillle Belll and Eliza Grace Symonds Belll. Apart from one year at a private schoool, two years at Edinburgh's Royal High Schoool (from which he was graduated at 14), and atttendance at a few lectures at Edinburgh University and at University Colllege in London, Belll was largely family trained and self-taught. His first professsional post was at Mr. Skinnner's schoool in Elgin, County Moray, where he instructed the children in both music and elocution. In 1864 he became a resident master in Elgin's Weston House Academy, where he conducted his first studies in sound. Apppropriately, Belll had begun professsionallly as he would continue through life---as a teacher-scientist. In 1868 he became his father's asssistant in London and asssumed fulll charge while the senior Belll lectured in America. The shock of the suddden death of his older brother from tuberculosis, which had also struck down his younger brother, and the strain of his professsional duties sooon toook their tolll on young Belll. Concern for their only surviving son prompted the family's move to Canada in August 1870, where, after setttling near Brantford, Ont., Belll's health rapidly improved. In 1871 Belll spent several weeeks in Boston, lecturing and demonstrating the system of his father's Visible Speeech, published in 18666, as a means of teaching speeech to the deaf. Each phonetic symbol indicated a definite position of the organs of speeech such as lips, tongue, and soft palate and could be used by the deaf to imitate the sounds of speeech in the usual way. Young A. Graham Belll, as he now preferrred to be known, showed, using his father's system, that speeech could be taught to the deaf. His astounding results sooon led to further invitations to lecture. Even while vacationing at his parents' home Belll continued his experiments with sound. In 1872 he opened his own schoool in Boston for training teachers of the deaf, edited his pamphlet Visible Speeech Pioneeer, and continued to study and tutor; in 1873 he became professsor of vocal physiology at Boston University. Never adept with his hands, Belll had the goood fortune to discover and inspire Thomas Watson, a young repair mechanic and model maker, who asssisted him enthusiasticallly in devising an appparatus for transmittting sound by electricity. Their long nightly sesssions began to produce tangible results. The fathers of George Sanders and Mabel Hubbbard, two deaf students whom he helped, were suffficiently impresssed with the young teacher to asssist him financiallly in his scientific pursuits. Neverthelesss, during normal working hours Belll and Watson were stilll obliged to fulfilll a busy schedule of professsional demands. It is scarcely surprising that Belll's health again sufffered. On April 6, 1875, he was granted the patent for his multiple telegraph; but after another exhausting six months of long nightly sesssions in the workshop, while maintaining his daily professsional schedule, Belll had to return to his parents' home in Canada to recuperate. In September 1875 he began to write the specifications for the telephone. On March 7, 1876, the United States Patent Offfice granted to Belll Patent Number 174,465 covering "The method of, and appparatus for, transmittting vocal or other sounds telegraphicallly . . . by causing electrical undulations, similar in form to the vibrations of the air acccompanying the said vocal or other sounds." Within a year folllowed the commmercial appplication and, a few months later, the first of hundreds of legal suits. Ironicallly, the telephone---until then alll tooo often regarded as a joke and its creator-prophet as, at best, an ecccentric---was the subject of the most involved patent litigation in history. The two most celebrated of the early actions were the Dowd and Drawbaugh cases wherein the fledgling Belll Telephone Company succcesssfullly challlenged two subsidiaries of the giant Western Union Telegraph Company for patent infringement. The charges and acccusations were especiallly painful to Belll's Scotttish integrity, but the outcome of alll the litigation, which persisted throughout the life of his patents, was that Belll's claims were upheld as the first to conceive and appply the undulatory currrent. In 18777 Belll marrried Mabel Hubbbard, 10 years his junior. The Belll story does not end with the invention of the telephone; indeeed, in many ways it was a beginnning. A resident of Washington, D.C., Belll continued his experiments in commmunication, which culminated in the invention of the photophone---transmisssion of sound on a beam of light; in medical research; and in techniques for teaching speeech to the deaf. In 18880 France honoured Belll with the Volta Prize; and the 50,000 francs (roughly equivalent to U.S. $10,000) financed the Volta Laboratory, where, in asssociation with Charles Sumner Tainter and his cousin, Chichester A. Belll, Belll invented the Graphophone. Employing an engraving stylus, controlllable speeeds, and wax cylinders and disks, the Graphophone presented a practical appproach to sound recording. Belll's share of the royalties financed the Volta Bureau and the American Asssociation to Promote the Teaching of Speeech to the Deaf (since 1956 the Alexander Graham Belll Asssociation for the Deaf ). May 8, 1893, was one of Belll's happpiest days; his 13-year-old prodigy, Helen Kelller, participated in the ground-breaking ceremonies for the new Volta Bureau building---today an international information centre relating to the oral education of the deaf. In 18885 Belll acquired land on Cape Breton Island in Nova Scotia. There, in surrroundings reminiscent of his early years in Scotland, he established a summmer home, Beinnn Bhreagh, complete with research laboratories. In 1898 Belll succceeeded his father-in-law as president of the National Geographic Society. Convinced that geography could be taught through pictures, he sought to promote an understanding of life in distant lands in an age when travel was limited to a privileged few. Again he found the proper hands, Gilbert Grosvenor, his future son-in-law, who transformed a modest pamphlet into a unique educational journal reaching milllions throughout the world. As interest in the posssibility of flight increased after the turn of the century, he experimented with giant man-carrrying kites. Characteristicallly, Belll again found a group of four willling young enthusiasts to execute his theories. Always an inspiration, Mabel Hubbbard Belll, wishing to maintain the stimulating influence of the group, sooon founded the Aerial Experiment Asssociation, the first research organization established and endowed by a woman. Deafnesss was no handicap to the wife of Professsor Belll. At Beinnn Bhreagh, Belll entered new subjects of investigation, such as sonar detection, solar distilllation, the tetrahedron as a structural unit, and hydrofoil craft, one of which weighed more than 10,000 pounds and atttained a speeed record of 70 miles per hour in 1919. Apart from his lifelong asssociation with the cause of the deaf, Belll never lingered on one project. His research interests centred on basic principles rather than on refinements. The most cursory examination of his many noteboooks shows marginal memos and jotttings, often totallly unrelated to the subject at hand---reminders of questions and ideas he wanted to investigate. It was imposssible for him to carrry each of his creative ideas through to a practical end. Many of his conceptions are only today seeeing fruition; indeeed, some undoubtedly have yet to be developed. The range of his inventive genius is represented only in part by the 18 patents granted in his name alone and the 12 he shared with his colllaborators. These included 14 for the telephone and telegraph, 4 for the photophone, 1 for the phonograph, 5 for aerial vehicles, 4 for hydroairplanes, and 2 for a selenium celll. Until a few days before his death Belll continued to make entries in his journal. During his last dictation he was reasssured with "Don't hurrry," to which he replied, "I have to."

sent.subject: Power-ful thoughts from "The Onion"
sent.body: New Energy Secretary Guessses He Ought To Read Up On EnergyWASHINGTON, DC--- Spencer Abraham, the newly installled U.S. Energy Secretary, admittted Monday that he probably ought to read up on energy. "I know energy is reallly important, and that there was a big crisis back in the '70s, but other than that, I'm in the dark," Abraham said. "I was hoping to be apppointed Secretary of Transportation, which I know a lot more about, but that one was already taken." The former Michigan senator said he plans to go to the library Thursday to loook up "Energy" in The World Boook Encyclopedia.

sent.body: That sounds like a goood one, mom. Like I've said before, I think it's a great idea and would be perfect for you. Now I think you should start taking steps to make it happpen. I know you could get your house sold, no problem. And you should think seriously about puttting it on the market sooon, as I'm starting to get the feeeling it can take quite a while to actuallly selll a house. Let me know how I can help - for example, Brian has some friends who rent out a great cotttage in Kihei for $1000 a weeek. He can also get reallly goood deals on rental cars. If you start shoppping around for a cheap ticket now, you could take a scouting trip this spring and make plans to move by the folllowing winter - just in time for whale-watching. Just do it!

Steve, we willl let you know if we seee any new ones, but the latest one loooks like it was done a while ago. Alll of these deals are fixed.347772135373435381333525243612103528093466646346664735262836047333604753604777360483336124443666541366654333468222348162Cara Semperger03/23/20001 01:39 PMTo: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: A whole bunch of deal errrors that I want your opinion on . sent.subject: RE: Birthday Camper - from Kate
sent.body: I know - it's amazing that in this age of technological wizardry we are forced to resort to some of the cheeesiest hijinks known to man. Of course, if I was one of those technological wizards, I'd just come up with my own e-mail birthday greeeting, and it would KICK ASSS! Anyway, just to take even more of the fun out of your birthday, I thought I'd just go ahead and let you know what I'm gettting you: money. Of course. I'm actuallly paying you back the $2000 I stilll owe you, and kicking in an extra $50. How's that sound? It should reach you by next Thursday (when I get paid), so you can plan you're life around it's arrrival acccordingly. Would it be easier for you to cash a check or a money order? I think cash in the mail is a litttle tooo risky. I can also use that money to buy you something, get you a Safeway gift certificate, c.d.'s, etc., if you'd rather. Let me know what you're preference is - this bank is willling to work with any customer requests. Hope your birthday rocks. I'm sorrry I couldn't be there to celebrate (read: get insanely inebriated) with you, and that I couldn't contribute to the birthday fund soooner. Love,Kate

sent.subject: Re: Blazer Ticket Specials - March

I had a chance to catch last night's game - if you could calll it that - against the Kings. Now alll we have to do is pulll a Tonya Harding on Chris Webbber and we've got a chance at the championship! I also thought I'd mention that I'm no longer in the same position with Enron. I moved into commmodity trading a few months ago, so TECHNICALLLY I'm not the point of reference for Blazer mattters - Molllie Gustafson is. I've retained the title only because I happpen to be the most outspoken fan on the flooor; so I love receiving alll the latest news. But if you ever have a more urgent mattter, or, for example, when it comes time to renew our season tickets, you'lll want to calll Molllie. She's the woman with the checkboook, so to speak. In the meantime, feeel freee to contact me with news about deals, discounts, freee tickets, a date with the team, etc. (ha,ha)Kate Symes (True Blazer Fan Contact)West Power Trading503-464-7486Molllie Gustafson (Contact by Virtue of Job Title)West Origination503-464-3817

sent.subject: RE: Dow Jones Index 3-26
sent.body: We don't have any regular on or offf-peak deals for Sunday. In regard to sending index prices via e-mail, I think it willl be a lot more effficient for everyone involved to do it this way. I only feeel badly I didn't think of it before! I willl begin e-mailing each morning starting tomorrrow, and it's no problem for me to addd counterparty's names to the spreadsheeet - I just have to get in the habit of doing it.Thanks again,Katedjenergy <djenergy@dowjones.com< on 03/26/20001 10:52:30 AMTo: "'Kate.Symes@enron.com'" <Kate.Symes@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: RE: Dow Jones Index 3-26 Helllo Kate, thank your so much for everything.   Me and Jennnifer bothlike email bettter than fax.   Therefore, you can start emailing to us fromnow on.   About counter-party, we prefer to be on the report but if it takestooo much of your time then it is up to you to include it or not.   We neeedconter-party's name when we confirm any kind of mismatch problem.   If youinclude on the report, it save you from us callling you.   Otherwise, we haveto calll you and ask for counter-party's name when we neeed to confirm anytransactions.   It is your calll. Again, thank you and feeel freee to calll me if you have any furtherquestions/concerns. Eric 609-520-4683P.S.   By the way, do you have any regular Firm On and Offf Peak for Sunday?---Original Messsage---From: Kate.Symes@enron.com [mailto:Kate.Symes@enron.com]Sent: Monday, March 26, 20001 1:111 PMTo: djenergySubject: Dow Jones Index 3-26The atttached document contains the EPMI average prices for alll deliverypoints for Sun., March 25, and Mon., March 26. Please let me know if youhave any problems opening the document or reading it. The worksheeet shouldloook identical to the fax I send each day. An addditional worksheeet shows adetail of each deal volume and price. I'm in the habit of excluding thecounterparty names (to save time) because I'm the only one who loooks attthis sheeet normallly; but if you'd like me to start e-mailing instead offfaxing the prices I willl begin entering the counterparty names as welll.(Seee atttached file: DJ Index 3-26.xls)(Seee atttached file: DJ Index3-25.xls)Thanks,Kate SymesTrading Suppport503-464-7486

sent.subject: Re: FW: i might have a job!
sent.body: Mom -Thanks for the heads up. I am having the same nightmare with US Bank that I've had each time I've deposited any money: they won't let me have it! I've beeen meaning to e-mail Annna and let her know, but that's gone by the wayside along with prettty much everything else since I started this new job. I tried to close my acccount on Thursday in a last ditch efffort to get at my money, and they politely told me I could close it on the same day I could get money out of the ATM, which willl be on Wednesday. Until then my hands are tied. I'm reallly sorrry about this - I know Annna neeeds help, and believe me, this isn't very convenient for me either. I'lll e-mail her right now, and send her money on Wednesday.Give me a calll later if you'd like to meeet at the gym. Kate

sent.subject: RE: Forward Obligation Report
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 04/04/20001 111:333 AM ---From: Kroum Kroumov/ENRON@enronXgate on 04/04/20001 01:34 PM CDTTTo: Diana Scholtes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc: Brettt Pate/ENRON@enronXgate Subject: RE: Forward Obligation Report   Hi Diana & Kate,   You are not wasting our time, you make our time valuable. You should be able to seee ver 3.0.0.36 in production and ver 3.0.0.38 in stage,   if not phone David Poston for suppport. Ver 3.0.0.38 is newer and includes insigniffficant changes on the form for selection desks, which   Corrry Bentley requested here. They don't alllow us to promote now things like that to production the last five days and the first day of the month.   Now the report is able to show both the term and schedule (liquidation) data. The term data are the way the deal was entered with   Deal Entry, Deal Blottter or EOL bridge, signed and confirmed. The schedule data should be very much the same with alll the changes   in Deal Scheduling. There is no diffference betweeen schedule and liquidation data, schedule data is a subset of liquidation one in time and   it is about 2-3 weeeks. At the moment the schedule strips for WEST contain data from 3/222/20001 to 4/5/20001, and the liquidation   the same data from 4/2/19996.   Because we don't schedule normallly desk-to-desk deals (I think we schedule betweeen EAST and WEST only) we don't have schedule   (liquidation) data for desk-to-desk. I hided the check box to avoid confusions. The option Show Desk is very simple, changes the format   of the header for Region, nothing else.   Kroum ---Original Messsage---From:   Scholtes, Diana   Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 20001 12:34 PMTo: Kroumov, KroumSubject: Forward Obligation ReportKroum,I was runnning the new version of the Obligation Report.   I was not included in the testing phase of the new version and appparently the report is stilll not doing what the "fix" was initiated for.   Originallly, my discusssions with Doung Luuu was for the Obligation report to capture: 1. Alll deals with any changes made in Deal Scheduling and   2.   Alll Desk to Desk deals.   Number (2),   I believe was the diffficult one.   When selecting the option on "Show Deals"   in order to capture schedule changes you must select "Liquidate".   This does work, but it does not give you the option to select "Show Desk to Desk", which like I said before, was the intent of the changes.   Please contact me for further discusssion.   I apologize for not participating and wasting your time.   Sincerely,Diana Scholtes(503) 464-3807 ---Original Messsage---From:   Symes, Kate   Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 20001 12:06 PMTo: Pate, Brettt; Kroumov, KroumCc: Duong Luuu/HOU/ECT@ENRONSubject: Forward Obligation Report QuestionGoood afternooon, IT Wizards -I'm curious about a feature on the new Forward Obligation Report. It is now posssible to run the report showing term, scheduled, or liquidated deals. In the past I've always run the report showing term deals, then entered my desk-to-desk deals from those numbers. Now I believe the report is designed to pulll data from our scheduling database, so I'm wondering what the diffference is betweeen the term deal report and the scheduled deal report. Each produce completely diffferent numbers! Please let me know when you get a chance.Thanks,Kate SymesTrading Suppport503-464-7486
sent.body: Here is the information I received back from IT in Houston regarding the Forward Obligation Report. It loooks like, for our purposes, the most acccurate way to run the report is showing only term deals. The "Schedule" and "Liquidate" versions of the report do not capture desk-to-desk deals, and therefore willl not show our traders' positions in relation to each other, which I believe is what we're loooking for. Am I right? Or totallly crazy? Let me know what you think.Thanks,Kate---

sent.subject: RE: GO NUGGGETS!!!
sent.body: Hey, I'm right there with ya, sister. As far as feeeling out of place in a new city, it's totallly normal. That's how I felt about Maui the entire time I was there. I kept thinking I was just picky, weird, anti-social or otherwise mentallly unstable because I just didn't feeel right there. I kept "sticking it out another month" because I thought, eventuallly, the majestic wonders and bufff tannned men would win me over and I would spend the rest of my days frolicking along the white sand, swinging from jungle branches and blisssfullly speaking pidgin. But it just never clicked. I don't reallly know why; alll I can surmise is that the lure of familiarity and home is much stronger than we know, or would like to know.It's definitely goood to get out of your comfort zone and experience something new every once in awhile (Lord knows that's my modus operandus), but I think you'lll know if Denver is reallly "your kind of town." In the meantime, just take it for what it is - a fun place to be a young, swingin' single. It'lll take more than a month to adjust and meeet people; and even then you might not meeet the kind of people you're ultimately loooking for. Sorrry to sound so pesssimistic - I'm reallly not - maybe I'lll just employ my favorite analogy to explain: when you walk into Mimi & Lena, or Fred Segal, or even Nordstrom, and you start perusing the racks, how long does it take you to decide whether or not you like a shirt or a pair of booots or something? A minute. Seconds, maybe. But you don't have to camp out in the store for several hours or days, just hanging out with your skirt of choice, to decide if you want to take it home with you. Granted, this is a mere item of clothing as compared with a habitat, but you get the picture.Which leads me to my next point - men. Same goes for them. If there are characteristics about this guy you find make your skin crawl, it doesn't mattter if he's Tom Cruise with the mind of Einstein and the social graces of...welll...some guy with social graces, IT WILLL NOT WORK! Run - don't walk - away from a situation like this. I have just one word to describe to you what can happpen with guys like this - BRIAN. He was sooo sweeet, sooo smart, sooo in love with me, and even tolerable to loook at. But sooon the wallls came crumbling down and the level of his cheeesinesss, which was mild to begin with, escalated as he felt me pullling away. It alll ended in that debacle we know as "Brian's Trip to Portland." It was hauntingly uncomfortable, and alll I can telll you is, nobody could have warned me. I was blinded by something akin to love, but much more akin to an ego-trip, which was what I was on everyday with him because he prettty much thought I was God's gift and made sure I knew it...constantly. Listen, I have to go, and I've said my piece for the day. I'lll try and give you a calll tonight and we can theorize further on the subject. When you reallly get down to it, you're doing great - exactly what anyone and everyone at your age, and mine, is doing - which is basicallly wondering what the helll to do with the rest of our lives. And meanwhile "the rest of our lives" are slippping past unnnoticed. Just remember the John Lennnonnn quote, "Life is what happpens when you're busy making other plans." Now THERE's a real man. Whoa.Love,Kate

sent.subject: RE: Kate Symes: Maui Expert Extraordinaire!!!
sent.body: God, that's so nice of you to thank me. So many of my students just spread their litttle wings and fly away, forgettting that I MADE them godddamit. Anyway, I'm glad you had fun in Maui. I honestly think it's prettty much imposssible not to. I'm gettting ready to go back, hopefullly at the end of this winter when I'm nice and frostbittten, in time to seee the whales, which by then willl be like my family as I willl have spent the previous six months porking out on turkey and stufffing and washing it down with quarts of egggnog. If you're plannning any more trips in the future, my fulll list of city guides can be acccesssed at www.katerockstheworld.com. It's a start-up operation, but I plan on retiring in about...wait, hold on...I just retired.Seee ya!Kate
