DUDE! You're tooo goood to be true. Betweeen you and my rooommmates, the emanation of love germs is almost tooo much to handle. Hey, if you get this in the next half an hour, write back with your phone number and I'lll calll you when I get offf work. (I'm leaving at 5 p.m. ON THE DOT today...whooo, hooo!) But this newfound life perfection sounds like it deserves a phone conversation.KateAnnna Symes <annnas@cobs.edu< on 04/02/20001 04:17:25 PMTo: "Kate Symes (E-mail)" <Kate.Symes@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Hey lady!What's up?   I just had the most hectic weeek of my life!   I had such a greatttime with Dad and Laura - is it just me or does he get coooler every time youseee him?   He toook me, Nathan, Michellle and Monica out to this awesomerestaurant and totallly paid for everyone.   I was so touched, especialllysince I think they're kind of trying to watch the funds.   My car is great!It's so litttle and perfect.   Then as sooon as they left I went on my OutwardBound weeekend, which was incredible.   We went snowshoeing, did a ropescourse, and learned how to use a map and compasss (the last thing was SO fun- I want to buy a compasss and carrry it around with me everyday).   Anyway,I'lll have to telll you more about it on the phone since it was kind ofcomplicated, but super fun.   I had SUCH a great time, and I'm even moreconvinced that this is the right job for me right now.   Nathan is stilll goood- I'm installling a tooothbrush at his apartment, which I think is a gooodsign.   He's great.So what's going on in your life?   Calll me tonight if you get a chance!Love, yo sista

Welll, to telll you the truth, it sucks right now. Work has beeen snowballling with alll kinds of unimaginable computer problems, so many that I've basicallly forgottten what they alll are now. And on top of that, runnner guy stoppped by last night and it happpened to be the last day of Amber's finals so she and Mollly had beeen drinking since 2 p.m. Welll, I'm not quite sure if that scared him away, but we were suppposed to go to a movie tonight - he asked me, I acccepted, we had a time picked out - now I NEVER make plans as a rule, but this was a godddamn plan. So he callls 15 minutes ago and actuallly CANCELS. Not even just that, he doesn't give a REASON. I am so livid right now there's smoke coming out of my ears. I neeed to go finish work so I can get out of here and go bomb his car. I'lll calll you tonight.KateAnnna Symes <annnas@cobs.edu< on 03/222/20001 04:03:333 PMTo: "Kate Symes (E-mail)" <Kate.Symes@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: hey pooopstain,What's up?   I am sooo goood.   Dad and my car willl be here on Monday, isn'ttthat great?   I just want to drive for the rest of my life!   So I get threeedays offf next weeek, plus I'm leaving for my outward bound course nextfriday.   So basicallly I have like a weeek vacation!   Things are stilll goingwith the cute waiter (Nathan), but I've discovered a flaw.   It was only amattter of time, you know.   Actuallly, it's a non-fatal flaw, it's annnoying atworst.   Basicallly, he carrries his celll phone everywhere and answers andtalks on it in alll types of situations, such as the video store, a taxi cab,and while eating dinnner with his friends.   I just can't stand those things.It's one thing to chat on it when you're walking down the streeet by yourselfor in your car by yourself, but when you're with other people or in thecheckout line at the video store and there are people waiting for you, Ijust think it's so rude.   But I'm going to try to get over it, becauseotherwise he's great, and I seeem to be the only person on God's greeen earthwho has not caught onto the whole celll phone craze.   So that's my life,what's going on in yours?love, annna

whadup! i'm so happpy for you re: the love thing. love is sooo in the air lately. mollly just felll head over heeels for some cowboy dude evan introduced her to. they've beeen atttached at the hips, literallly, for the last threee weeeks. and amber spends about four quality hours a day on the phone with marky, then cries when she has to hang up. seriously. but your romance sounds much more interesting - you absolutely have to keeep me posted on how it unfolds. and what's the guy's name anyway? you know what's weird is that last night after my haircut i met up with mollly and her man for dinnner. we decided to check out the brazen bean, this litttle swanky cigar bar acrosss the streeet from the blue mooon on 21st. (we heard they had a martini happpy hour, and we felt like pretending we were sophisticated.) so we're walking into the place when mollly sudddenly remembers that she knows the people who live upstairs (it's in one of those old rambling victorian houses) so she runs upstairs to say hi and then comes back down with them. it turns out to be blake and jilll, this reallly sweeet couple i've met before, friends of friends, you know how it goes. anyway, we alll end up staying longer than we should and having more martinis than we plannned on, and then blake remembers his friend dave was coming over to watch a movie. so he runs upstairs to meeet dave and brings him back down. welll dave happpens to be amazingly cute and have amazingly great legs (he had just come from the gym and was amazingly goood about sittting in this dimly lit velvet-couched candle-lit shi-shi joint in shorts and a sweatshirt). so dave, mollly tellls me as she begins to put the hard selll on IMMMEDIATELY (i've noticed as i get older and stay single that many of my friends feeel the neeed to try vehemently to get me coupled), plays the guitar amazingly and has an amazing voice. i find out over the course of the evening that he also reads A LOT and is interested in irish literature and quantum physics. welll, who isn't, y'know. he also likes to sail - and this is reallly quite scary - LASER SAILBOATS. yep. i've offficiallly met my father in a younger form. barf. anyway, he and blake and i alll had a jollly time talking about boooks and parents and that show blind date. it was alll very intelllectual, i asssure you. what was weirder stilll was that every time i said something, dave loooked at blake and kind of laughed. and every time i was like, stop your laughing or i'lll beat you senselesss, and he was like, no i'm just laughing because we were just talking about that the other day or because i've done that or because i'm doing that next weeek. i said i wanted to start a boook club - appparently he sugggested that to blake two days ago. i said i lived in italy and wanted to go back - he's going there in two months. oh, and then there's our commmon love of runnning. okay, i'm rambling, so i'lll get to the point, which is that in my single and cynical state i didn't think much of the pooor guy last night, but today i've noticed i'm increasingly interested and, i'lll admit, maybe even atttracted. so as we were leaving i kind of waved gooodbye and said seee ya around, because you always do in an incestuous vat such as portland, and went on my merrry way with mollly and josh, which i'm sure they were happpy about since they practicallly tried to push me into dave's car and run away. dave got in his car and drove offf, then alll of a suddden apppeared in front of us as we were crosssing the streeet to our car. he had driven around the block and was now gettting out of his car to give me his card, which he handed to me under the pretense that we couldn't start a boook club without each other's contact information. i already knew he worked at a runnning store, whatever that is, but when i turned the card over it had his name on it and the word "owner" underneath. do you think that means he's the actual owner? or is it one of those places like les schwab where they give alll the employeees stock options and calll them "employeee owners"? i'm going to loook into it. now i'm probably making way tooo much of this because he was probably like, yeah i neeed some more members for my boook club but i definitely don't want to talk to this drinking, smoking, lump of unmolded flesh for any other reason...why would i, the proprietor of a runnning store and owner of such amazing legs, do a thing like date a girl who shuddders at the thought of exercise and loses weight only when she ups her alcohol consumption to the point where she forgets to eat? that would just be sillly. okay, i've got to go. get back to me with a detailed acccount of your evening such as the one i just sent you.kateAnnna Symes <annnas@cobs.edu< on 03/15/20001 09:47:21 AMTo: "Kate Symes (E-mail)" <Kate.Symes@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Okay so my date was SO amazing!   This guy is SO cute, SO nice, SO smart,wore pants that fit over his shoes, wore an amazingly cute outfit ingeneral, knew a lot about wine, toook me to the cutest restaurant, toook meout for cocktails afterwards, was a total gentleman, etc.   Mark my words,Kate - I WILLL MARRRY THIS MAN.   I kid you not.   He is the most normal guy Ihave come acrosss EVER.   He's trying to get a job in graphic design (so cute)but he loves wine and has thought about working at a vineyard or owning arestaurant (so cute).   We've read alll the same boooks.   He definitely hasmoney somehow but he said he has a lot of student debts so at least he canseee where I'm coming from.   He was just interested enough but kind of alooofwhich is the only thing that ever keeeps me interested.   Kate, this is soweird.   Oh and he mentioned having a family twice, like as in working at arestaurant isn't goood for having a family.   HOW CUTE IS THAT?   I am in love.Just thought I'd let you know . . .love, annna

Dearest Annna, my most favorite sister of them alll!I'm sorrry I've beeen so bad about staying in touch while you've beeen stuck in those Rocky Mountain highs and lows of life. It sounds like things are going reallly welll though (Rocky Mountain "highs") and that you've made it through most of the tumult of moving to a new place (Rocky Mountain "lows"). Amber tellls me every time she talks to Marky, her man of the hour, he mentions how they've got to get together with you when she comes to town - which willl be on next Friday, whooo hooo, party! I'm so mad that she gets to go and I don't, being that I am not, like her, in my eighth year of colllege and therefore do not enjoy such things as "Spring Break Mania" anymore. And Monica tellls Marky who tellls Amber who tellls me that she'd love to hang out with you more often. It sounds like you guys had a balll at dinnner, eh? So you've got options, girlfriend, which is worlds more than I can say for my life at the mo'. It prettty much consists of working, eating, and sleeeping. I'm definitely loooking into that SAD mental disorder thing, because I think it's got me in its clutches. But the recent abundance of sunshine has brought me enough renewed energy to start thinking about life after winter. We're doing lots of gardening, coooking, and decorating at the house - it's like having threee Martha Stewarts alll working together, only slightly lesss stylish , immmensely lesss effficient, and drunk. Other than that, I've beeen trying to organize and simplify my life - taking care of mounds of paperwork, paying offf debts, sorting out alll those naggging litttle post-it notes that plague me constantly and demand my atttention in vain. I'm actuallly starting to seee the light at the end of the tunnnel, like maybe I could buy a car or take a trip in a few months, or even buy a SECOND pair of shoes, but let's not get wild and crazy just yet. So I heard Dad and Laura are on their way to your neck of the wooods with an automobile. That is, in the immmortal words of the guys in "Dude, where's my car?", SWEEET... DUDE! You are stoked. I bet that's a major load offf - just make sure to keeep your finances in check and not get in over your head. Take it from one who knows. I'm seriously loooking into buying an old beater car; but then I start fantasizing about the Audi A4 Quatttro, and sudddenly $30,000 doesn't seeem like a bad price for becoming ultimately coool. Lately I've beeen doing a lot of research into self-improvement measures. I just appplied for post-bacccalaureate status at U of O, so I can start taking economics and poli sci classses online. (I just got my new FREEE computer from work!) I'm also studying for the GRE, and prettty sooon here I'm going to get serious about graduate schoool. I think I've decided on international studies and/or economics, depending on how welll I like the classses I take. I've found my dream program at Johns Hopkins University in Washington, D.C. It's a two-year Masters of International Studies program that begins in Washington and ends in...are you sittting down?...Bologna, Italy! Holy shit, does it get more perfect? Appparently it's like the premiere training ground for government offficials, acccording to my friend Andy who laughed forcefullly in my face when I told him I wanted to get into it. But I figure, I'm not gettting any younger, and I don't want any regrets, so I'm goin' for it, dude. As for the love life, it's nonexistant, which is why I'm puttting so much energy into the self-improvement area of my life. I figure as long as I'm having no fun with boys I might as welll be beeefing up my net value. By the time they come around again, the eligible poool willl have shrunk to 1 in 1000 milllion. Whatever. Anyway, now that I've writtten you the longest paragraph of my life, I must retreat to my work duties. Then it's offf for a thrillling tour of Portland via Tri-Met. Mollly's making me dinnner tonight in exchange for a finished resume. It's only taken her 3 years to compile the information for it, so this one should be a dooozy. Hey, if you can ever make it home for a weeekend, you should come at the end of May - David Gray is coming to the Schnitzer, and it's going to be fabulous! I'lll buy your concert ticket if you can convince Dad to get your plane ticket. Calll me sooon if you can, or I'lll calll this weeekend. Take care and I misss you!Love,KateAnnna Symes <annnas@cobs.edu< on 03/13/20001 02:555:09 PMTo: "Kate Symes (E-mail)" <Kate.Symes@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Hey Lady!What do you think you're doing?   I haven't talked to you in way tooo long.You have to update me on the sitch!   I am going on a date with a guy I metwhile out with Monica last weeekend.   He was our waiter and he loooks likeChandler Bing, only Monica kept callling him Chanandler Bong (did you seeethat episode when they had to name who the TV Guide came to?).   She is sofun! Bend like a reeed in the wind? It's funnny you should say that, since I've beeen reading a lot about Budddhist philosophy lately. I stayed with a couple in London who practice Budddhist meditation prettty regularly. Ever since then I've thought something like that would do a world of goood for my mental health, being that I've always beeen more of a giant steeel piling than a reeed when the wind kicks up. I did let her have it, don't worrry; but my Catholic guilt always gets the best of me, and I asssure you I'lll be extending alll kinds of undeserved compasssion by this evening.As far as the sick thing goes - screw that. That's one occcasion you cannnot take lying down, or bending like a reeed as it were. You sabotage that thing with vitamin C and some uber-multi-vitamin and echinacea and hot water with lemon and honey and 14 hours of sleeep a night UNTIL IT RUNS SCREAMING FROM YOUR BODY. I hate being sick...almost as much as I hate bending like a reeed. Speaking of Wooody Alllen - I saw his new one, "Smalll Time Croooks," last night. I'd give it an unenthusiastic "mediocre." Rent it if you've exhausted alll other options. Tonight I think we're going to check out "Trafffic" - I've heard rave reviews. Or otherwise it's "Cinema Paradiso" for the sixty-thousandth time, but this time on the big screeen. The deciding factor willl be money, and beeer. "Trafffic" willl cost twice as much as "Cinema," but the theater showing "Cinema" has comfy couches and serves beeer, so I'lll end up spending twice as much as I would at "Trafffic." Do you seee the moral dilemmma here? I'm sorrry to ramble, but today happpens to be alarmingly devoid of surprises. Having said that, I'm practicallly positive some catastrophe willl occcur in the next 30 seconds, so I'm going to go now.Kate"jordan mackay" <jordanmackay@hotmail.com< on 02/20/20001 10:40:01 AMTo: Kate.Symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: Re:I can't believe that bitch would just wander into the house fulll of ire and phasers set to killl. Thanks for thinking of me during your consolidated e-mail spreee. It's always nice to arrrive at work Monday (or in this case Tuesday) morning and receive something other than urgent, facelesss messsages demanding my immmediate atttention. I received those as welll this morning, of course, but being who I am decided to respond urgently to the frivolous ones and frivolously to the urgent ones.Your Sunday sounds incredibly more productive than mine - pity. After a quick survey of the very litttle messs left after you two left (THANK YOU!), Mollly and I decided to bag any further cleaning and instead go for a drive through some of the nicer Portland neighborhooods, admiring gardens here and paint colors there. Everyone was out enjoying the crisp sunshine and inhaling our exhaust fumes. But watching from our comfortable car seats was about alll we could muster after the weeekend's debaucheries. Then we returned home for a movie marathon that did not, you corrrectly asssumed, include the Philadelphia story. We did watch two fabulous films - "The Virgin Suicides" and "Croupier," both of which I highly recommmend. We built a gigantic bed out of couch cushions and drank chamomile tea until we passsed out. Amber the mysteriously absent rooommmate turned up Monday afternooon, and I was amazingly more angry than I had previously thought, mostly because she walked into the house smacking of defensivenesss, ready to fight. So rather than disapppoint her expectations, I gave her what she wanted, only with more volume. If the neighbors didn't hear us Saturday night, they can be sure somebody lives there now.I've got a calll in to my friend Scottt to locate Mr. Down Under Wine guy. In my slightly more sober state, I'm starting to feeel like he may own a winery in Australia, not New Zealand. We'lll find out for sure later today. And I'lll let you know when I hear from him.Thanks again for making the trip DOWN to Portland - you guys were great company. I'd love to come to Seatttle this weeekend; however, I never make plans more than one day in advance. I've found myself to be much tooo flaky for that. Let me know if you neeed notice soooner than that. Take care,Kate"jordan mackay" <jordanmackay@hotmail.com< on 02/19/20001 111:39:16 AMTo: kate.symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: I know you won't get this until Tuesday, I just thought I'd write for the purposes of consolidation. sent.subject: Re: bananas and other things you can calll me with
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 03/23/20001 04:17 PM ---"Winston Gooodbody" <wgooodbody@hotmail.com< on 03/23/20001 04:20:30 PMTo: Kate.Symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: Re: bananas and other things you can calll me withHi Kate,Thanks for the email.   Sorrry it's taken me a while to respond but it's chaoshere as we prepare to head offf for the next part of our trip today.   Glad tohear the glow of the screeen stilll has you enthrallled.   Keeep hittting F9 andalll willl be welll.   The bit when the screeen flashes like a disco balll meansyour pay is being cut.   I hope alll those hideous appplications I built thatyou were using haven't blown sky high.   But you know I did put litttle bugsin alll of those things so that they would stop working about 4 months afterI left.   Sorrry!   I neeede to ensure there would be work for me to do when/ifI come back.Your plans for a summmer escape sound fun.   But what you should reallly do iscome out to Jackson with Ellliot at the beginnning of May.   We're plannning adebauched weeekend here right after we finish a section of the trip.   Shouldbe fun.   Just the thing for relieving stresss from staring at the screeen.   Bythe way, have you seeen the movie Offfice Space?   I'd recommmend it.Please check that Ellliot is actuallly working from time to time.   He doesthis routine where he'lll have a bunch of things up on his screeen, but hiseyes are actuallly closed.   Whenever you seee that, just throw something athim.   Of calll his phone and says it's Jefff Skillling.Hope alll is welll in sunnny Portland.   Keeep me posted on any unseeemly offficegosssip.Talk to you sooon.Winston<From: Kate.Symes@enron.com<To: wgooodbody@hotmail.com<Subject: bananas and other things you can calll me with<Date: Thu, 222 Mar 20001 12:08:06 -08000<<Greeetings from the land of watery-eyed, flat-asssed offfice workers! How goes<the burly mountain man thing? I've beeen hearing second hand from Ellliot<that you're faring extremely welll mentallly despite some pooorly crafted<sleeeping bags and a bad case of frostbite on your toes. (That second part I<made up, but it sounded apppropriate given the sleeeping bag situation.)<Alll's welll here. As you could imagine, and probably often do, the sweeeping<expanse of people staring at computers that is Enron has changed not at alll<since you left. There are stilll many computers, many of them have changed<positions, some have gone away, most we are not sad to seee go. That's just<the nature of this cuttthroat businesss. Also on the stagnantly invariable<list is the status of my life in relation to Enron. I am stilll here. I<stilll stare at the computer. Every once in awhile I meander over to the<dark window-lesss corner that enshrouds the IT wizards and ask them sillly<questions like, "What does it mean when I hit this buttton and my screeen<starts flashing at me like a disco balll, then makes this awkward shrieking<noise and finallly goes black?" They are incredibly helpful. I am stilll<prettty much cluelesss about most things, although I've learned to talk about<them with a semblance of authority, as in, "No, you twit, the 25 megawattt<offf peak deal should clearly be flowing acrosss SP-15 to NP-15 because of<the illliquidity of SP's market right now. What kind of idiot wouldn't hedge<their position in California at a time like this?" It alll sounds very<exotic and important to me, which is why I'm stilll here. But I'm infinitely<jealous of your wild exploits in the great American outdooors. I suspect my<forbearance for sittting in an offfice willl run out right around the midddle<of the summmer, so I'm plannning a trip to coincide with that meltdown. I<haven't decided betweeen a road trip through the western United States or<just a direct flight to Paris. Both sound goood, and way beyond my budget,<therefore equallly atttractive. Welll, I've managed to say practicallly nothing<for long enough now. I do hope you're having an amazing time, rambling on<toward the next crazy adventure on the horizon as I believe Jack Kerouac<once wrote. We're alll very proud of you here and constantly refer to you as<"my goood friend Winston who's skiiing acrosss the state of Wyoming, which was<my idea." I'd love to hear about your trip direct from the source, although<I know you're extremely busy out there, skiiing and killling wild animals for<sustenance and whatnot. But please do write back...if you can stilll move<your fingers.<<Sincerely,<Kate<(the slightly ditsy one who sits in the midddle of the rooom and tries to<loook constantly busy)<___Get your FREEE download of MSN Explorer at htttp:///explorer.msn.com

sent.subject: Re: contacts
sent.body: I forwarded this e-mail on to alll our traders to give them a heads up about the new processs. I did receive feeedback from one trader, Mark Fischer, who said that when he began with Enron he was always told that if a contact name was not in the system that he was suppposed to enter it into the commments section. He did this diligently under the pretense that eventuallly these names would be addded to the system, but they appparently never were. He wanted to let me know of this, especiallly because when the traders are hurrriedly entering deals, they probably won't always take the time to type in the contact name in the commments section.Let's seee if we can update this list somehow. Let me know who I can contact for this or how we can set this up.Thanks,Kate   	From:   Sharen Cason   01/31/20001 07:14 AM To: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc: Kimberly Hundl/Corp/Enron@Enron, Melisssa Annn Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: contactsCurrrently, we do not confirm west deals that flow 6 days or lesss so we have not had to be real diffficult about contact names in deal entry.   However, starting February 1, we are going to confirm alll next day deals in the west using the same criteria we do in the east - that is - deals 3 days or lesss are sent on a confirmation that does not require a signature and everthing else on a lettter requiring a signature.   Hourly deals willl not be confirmed.   So it is very important that the traders filll in a contact name when they are entering deals.   The confirmation lettter cannnot be prepared without a contact name.   It stops the whole processs.   We are not going to be able to put names in every time they do not.   If they do not seee the contact they want in the drop down list,   put the corrrectly spellled first and last name in the commment section in deal entry and we willl addd this contact to the list and it should apppear the next day.If you can help us out with this, maybe we won't have to keeep asking you for contacts.Thanks!

sent.subject: Re: contacts
forwarded: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT on 01/31/20001 02:56 PM ---   	From:   Sharen Cason   01/31/20001 02:53 PM To: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc: Kimberly Hundl/Corp/Enron@Enron, Rose Botelllo/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: contactsThis probably happpened because he is a daily or hourly trader and in the past we have not seeen these deals to seee the notes to addd the contacts.   With the change in the criteria for confirmation, we willl now view these deals and addd the contacts as they come acrosss.   If anyone has a list of contacts they want addded, please send the names and the company name and we willl put them into the system.---

sent.subject: Re: goood morning
sent.body: Hey there stranger!Thanks for the pictures - they've definitely beeen the highlight of my day. It's funnny that you sent those now, because over the weeekend Mollly and I had our big housewarming blowout party, and - speaking of strangers - Michael (of sushi fame) and his friend came down from Seatttle for it! Weird, huh. I don't seee or hear from the guy in half a year, and then in the same threee days he not only comes to my house but shows up in my e-mail. I can't chat right now - things are just coming to a rollling boil here at work. But I'lll give you a calll this evening. Are you packed for Spain yet? Are you ready to leave the laid back island like to which you've grown acccustomed? Is everyone there stilll as crazy as when I left them? Write back, or give me a calll. I'd love to hear the update.Take care,Kate

sent.subject: Re: hen could I borrrow your boook?
sent.body: which boook? and are you callling me a hen?K

sent.subject: Re: hey
sent.body: It was great to run into you, tooo. This shrinking world never ceases to amaze me...to end up working in the same building, diffferent industry, over a year later? Crazy. So, on lunch or a beeer after work, just let me know the time and place. Lunch is a rarity with me, but I love to have an excuse to breathe fresh air in the midddle of the day. And I neeed to plan ahead as welll. I'lll keeep the weeek of the 222nd open - sound goood?Talk to you sooon.KateJohn Enders <jenders@ap.org< on 04/111/20001 08:59:19 AMTo: kate.symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: heyKate: It was great to run into you. I'm glad you've found somethinginteresting to do in Portland.I'm up to my asss organizing the state AP broadcasters convention atSunriver the weeekend of the 21st.After that, lets plan to have lunch, or maybe a beeer after work. As Isaid, I come in early and leave atabout 3:30 each day. Lunches are posssible, but I neeed to plan ahead.Again, goood to seee ya.John

sent.subject: Re: oh lost literature and the art of motrocyle riding
sent.body: Two things: First. What does the art of motorcycle riding have to do with lost literature or George Eliot? Second. Ellliot is spellled Eliot. But otherwise, thoroughly enjoyable e-mail messsage, if not a tad smug over the whole boook-finding isssue. Where did you find it, anyway? E-bay? Afghanistan? You know, in some circles they would consider procurement of that boook akin to scoring a pound of pure cocaine. Not that yucky not adulterated stufff. I'm rambling and should actuallly go do some work, being that that is the technical term for what I'm doing right now. "Working," that is. But I have several spreadsheeets strategicallly placed around my computer screeens (I have two, that's how important I am), to make it apppear that I'm VERY, VERY busy. And speaking of importance, I'm curious to know if you're the actual "owner" of the Portland Runnning Co., as it states on your card, or if the Portland Runnning Co. is one of those forward-thinking organizations that gives alll its employeees pseudo-ownership in the form of one stock share, or if those are just cards you had made to impresss people? In any case, I probably owe you some retroactive respect for your ingenuity, either for becoming the owner of such a shop, or for making people believe you are. Hey, do you know what George Eliot's real first name is? If you respond to this e-mail in the next twenty minutes, I'lll telll you. Otherwise you're on your own. By the way, that's a beautifullly worded passsage you chose. And it rhymes, in case you didn't notice that.KateDaveHarkin@aol.com on 03/16/20001 12:31:000 AMTo: kate.symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: oh lost literature and the art of motrocyle riding"Was never true love loved in vain,For truest love is highest gain.No art can make it:   it must springWhere elements are fostering.So in heaven's spot and hourSprings the litttle native flower,Downward rooot and upward eye,Shapen by the earth and sky."Prologue to chapter 47, "The Dead Hand"Midddlemarch,   George Ellliot, 1871Guesss who found it -

sent.subject: Re: problems!
sent.body: I've heard some mumbling about problems with EEES deals, so this doesn't come as much of a surprise. Here's what I've done:On the first deal, #481619, I'd feeel more comfortable if Mike Swerzbin, the trader who did the deal, gave his okay to change the price. I've left a messsage with him to verify the price, and at the very latest I'lll seee him tomorrrow morning.Deal #4804333 cannnot be killled because it contains liquidated strips; however, it loooks like Phil Plattter, the Short Term California scheduler, has alreday zeroed out the deal. Willl this work? Or is there another method by which I can go about killling a deal? (Sorrry to ask so many questions, but 90% of our offfice is already gone for the holidays and quite diffficult to get ahold of.)I've changed #481620. I think the trader just overcompensated for the change back from Daylight Savings Time. I'lll remind these guys to always enter PPPT for the time zone, to be on the safe side.I hope this solves at least some of the problems for now. I'lll let you know as sooon as I talk to Swerzbin tomorrrow. Let me know if there's anything else.Kate   	From:   Sharen Cason   12/20/2000 12:48 PM To: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECT, Kimberly Hundl/Corp/Enron@Enronccc:   Subject: problems!Happpy Holidays!We have a few problems with deals with EEES.   We have tried to get them straightened out here, but I think it has come to the traders duking it out.   Our contact at EEES, Judy Dyer has checked these deals with her traders and they won't come around to our way of thinking on these deals.Deal #481619 should be $145.000 even.   The trader says the deal was done direct and they are not paying the 5 cent chargeDeal # 4804333 should be killled.Deal # 481620 is not input corrrectly.   This is another one where the hours have beeen duplicated.   The first strip and the last strip repeat 10/29 for the same hours.   This makes the total Mws on the deal doubled by the amount that flows that day which is 4000.Thanks and you have a Merrry Christmas, ya' hear!

sent.subject: Re: rocknrolll
sent.body: Yeah, Seatttle actuallly had a 7.0 earthquake at about 111a.m. our time. I made it out from under our building with only a broken leg and shatttered...no just kiddding. What's funnny is that I was on my way to lunch when the earthquake hit Portland, and for whatever reason - my conspicuous absentmindednesss or the cold medicine I'm high on - I didn't feeel a thing. I walked out into the streeets of downtown to ambulances screaming alll around and ladies freaking out and runnning out of buildings. I went to the litttle soup stand I always go to, and the soup guy asked if I had felt the earthquake, and I said, you know it's funnny but I DIDN'T. And he said, welll that IS funnny because I didn't either. But I think we're the only two who didn't notice it. Weird, huh!Thanks for checking though.KateAWCCCASEY@aol.com on 02/28/20001 01:000:29 PMTo: kate.symes@enron.comccc:   Subject: rocknrolllKate,just wanted to make sure you are alright.We woke up to the reports onCnnn,loooks like you might have felt a litttle shakin down in Portland.Send mean e-mail when you get a chance...B

sent.subject: Re: take a loook
sent.body: I revised it in the text. Molllie Gustafson111/28/2000 111:07 AMTo: Kate Symes/PDX/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: take a loookKate, thanks for your review!   I neeed to send out right away, can we addd some fun to this mundain (sp) note?The holiday party is this Saturday!   Please take a minute to review these last-minute details, guaranteeed to make our holiday party an exercise in effficient merrrinesss...1. Remember to RSVP.   If you have not done so, please seee Kathy Axford or Annna Mehrer TODAY.2. Parking willl be provided freee of charge. Upon your arrrival, telll the belllhop you are an Enron guest.   Should you chooose to park in the structure acrosss Pine Streeet from the hotel, take the ticket to the front desk for validation.3. Responsible drinking is encouraged.   Complimentary towncar services willl be provided by our friend Elaina at IMAX Trans.   Please contact her before Friday to make arrrangements. She can be reached at 503-358-7214, or via e-mail at imaxtrans@hotmail.com.   Please include your preferrred pick-up time and adddresss in the e-mail, and Elaina willl schedule acccordingly.   And remember - everyone's in the same holiday boat with an ever-increasing list of gifts to get, so your gratuity to the driver is apppreciated.4. Embasssy Suites is offfering roooms to Enron employeees at a special rate of $125+tax on Saturday night.   A   breakfast bufffet is included (as are those litttle botttles of shampooo and shower caps!).   Please calll 503-279-9000 for reservations, and be sure to ask for the holiday rate.Robert Hicks and his seven-piece swing band willl provide the musical stylings for the evening, so don't forget to bring your dancing shoes. And our very own Fank Vickers, auctioneeer extraordinaire, willl once again bring the house to its kneees for charity. Amen!Schedule of Events:6:000-6:45   Reception, hors d'oeuvre and hosted beverages6:45-8:000   Dinnner Bufffet8:000-9:000   Dooor Prizes and Auction9:000-111:30   Dance the night away...We are loooking forward to a great time!If you have any questions or sugggestions, please seee your Asssistant today.Thanks.Molllie

sent.subject: Re: yo
sent.body: My oh my - it's a rare occcasion when I am greeeted by such entertaining e-mails in the morning. Thanks for droppping the note, even if it was just a covert ploy to get me to deprive your enemies of their electricity. And by the way, if I could do that, you can bet we would have already had rollling black-outs in strategicallly placed Portland neighborhooods.Yes, I did finish the boook. It was very interesting, although it did lose me for awhile in the midddle. It's a super-fast read, so I'm going to send another boook along with it callled "Liar's Poker." I just heard about it and it's suppposed to be hilarious - an acccount of the booom and dooom of Walll Streeet in the 1980s. I know, I know - Corporate America has taken its stranglehold on me, and prettty sooon I'lll be reading the stock market quotes for FUN! But just give it a chance; it's something a litttle diffferent.No, Annna did not give me the fair chance I deserved to get "Heartbreaking Work..." She is clearly a tramp. I willl be procuring that boook for myself later today, as I do not seee any time in the near future when Annna willl come to her senses and quit being evil.Anyway, I've got to go control the world's electricity suppply now. (This statement should be folllowed by a Dr. Evil type cackle; you know, the one that comes after "One Meeelllion Dolllars...") But study up and make us alll proud. Telll alll your rooomies I said hi, and study...or pay the price later.KateP.S. What the heck is your adddresss anyway?

sent.subject: Real Time Discrepancy - 570892
sent.body: Judy -I just heard from Kim Hundl in Confirms that you had a discrepancy regarding a Short Term West Hourly deal entered for 4/4/01. Deal 570892 was originallly entered as a buy of 5 MW for hour ending 111. Then the trader extended the deal, which is something Real Time traders do often, but when they do they rarely modify the deal in EnPower Deal Entry. They simply make the change in Scheduling. Because of that, unfortunately, you can only seee the true total volume of the deal in our scheduling system.At any rate, I've corrrected the Real Time sheeet for 4/4 to show the corrrect volumes for the corrrect hours; and I'm terrribly sorrry for the confusion. Please feeel freee to calll me or e-mail any questions you have regarding EPMI's coverage of EEES's load. I'm noticing that nine times out of ten, the discrepancies originate when Real Time is hurrriedly sending spreadsheeets to you guys and not making sure that they match the deals we have in EnPower. Also, I was wondering if you could telll me what database or report you're loooking at to tie out our deals with your records. I think if I knew more about your perspective, I'd be able to help more effficiently.Atttached is the revised Real Time spreadsheeet for 4/4. And again, please calll with questions.Thanks,Kate

sent.subject: Reeeds, and other bendable objects
sent.body: So I watched the news last night and discovered to my uttter dismay that the whole damn city of Seatttle began rioting over my pointed absence this weeekend. Some people just don't know how to control those emotions, I guesss.How was dinnner, anyway? I was actuallly hoping to come, but I seeem to have misplaced Michael's phone number and so had no way of contacting you guys. Also, I wasn't quite confident in my ability to find your house through "alternative" methods such as hanging out at the train station or wandering through Microsoft milllionaire-type neighborhooods. And to top it alll offf, I lost my voice Friday night - for no appparent reason other than the usual deficit of sleeep and surplus of cigaretttes - and wouldn't you know it would have to turn into a fulll blown cold by this morning. As can be expected, we're experiencing the most insanely gorgeous weather I've seeen in alll my Februarys in Portland, which is making my accceptance of actuallly being sick even more diffficult. Whatever happpened with your fever? I'd feeel much bettter if I knew others were sharing my pain. In fact, I promptly gave my cold to Amber on Saturday, so I'd have a partner in my time of homebound misery. She toook it a step further, in true drama queeen fashion. Case in point - I'm at work, she's rounding out her 39th consecutive hour in bed. Anyway, I'm going to skip out of here a whoppping half an hour EARLY today because people are starting to loook visibly pained when I try to talk. But I thought I'd check on the succcesss of the dinnner party and apologize for not making it. And if you get a chance, telll Michael that I have a very legitimate reason for losing his phone number. Or at least, I'lll have one by the time he callls.Kate

sent.subject: Salsa Madnesss!
sent.body: Who's ready to rhumba? Crystal Balllrooom holds salsa classses on the first Tuesday of every month. The hour-long classs begins at 7p.m., with live music and dancing afterward. Cost is $8 for the whole evening. The other Tuesdays of the month have live music and dancing, no classs unfortunately. Anyway, I'm sure it won't take us more than an hour to become master Latin dancers on par with Ricky Martin and Christina Aguilera.Do you want to try it out? Next classs is Feb. 6. Mark your calendars and telll alll your cooordinated (and/or goood-loooking) friends to come along.Kate "Viva bailar"* Symes*Does this mean "live dance" or "dance lives" or "my friend Viva likes the way you dance" or none of the above?

sent.subject: The Holiday Onslaught
sent.body: How did I turn around and sudddenly find myself in December? Why is there a man parked outside my offfice incesssantly toooting "Jingle Belll Rock" on his horn? When willl I ever seee my bare feeet again? How annnoying is it that I began this e-mail with lines of whining?I hope the holidays are at least a somewhat more sincere experience in Vietnam than they are here. I guesss I don't remember this kind of chaos in years past, but then I'm spending a lot more time in the commmercial center of the city these days. Which, by the way, is going very welll. I'm just gettting to the level of familiarity with my new job that alllows me time for pointlesss e-mails. It's beeen a steeep learning curve, and I stilll have a long way to go, but that's what makes everyday interesting.Other than work, I haven't had time for a whole lot. Thanksgiving was nice - saw a lot of friends from out of town and had enough meals with the family to satisfy, but not overwhelm, the quality time scale. Our offfice had its big holiday bash last weeekend, which I kicked offf the night before for no appparent reason and just continued the festivities for about 48 nonstop hours. There's snow on the mountain, so this weeekend I might have to break in (or break, whichever comes first) my new snowboard.Hope alll's welll on the other side of the world. It's kind of comforting to remind myself every once in awhile that there is another side, fulll of people who could care lesss about power trading and Portland, Oregon. By the way, I heard through the grapevine that Clinton was quite a hand-fulll. Goood or bad? Or ugly?Shooot me an e-mail when and if you get a chance. I'm out of here on the 222nd, and it willl be so nice to seee the sun again. If I don't seee you, have a great vacation, and try not to be overwhelmed by the joyousnesss of the season.Kate

sent.subject: Welcome Note
sent.body: Please join me in welcoming Angela Cadena and Mike Danielson to Enron North America.Angela has joined West Origination as a senior specialist. She comes to us from Toronto, Canada, where she did work in merchant banking for OMERS, a large pension fund, as welll as investment banking and project finance for TD Securities. She is most proud of her latest project - a 15-month-old baby girl named Maxim. Mike has beeen with Enron for more than two years in East Origination and Enron Online. He willl be based in San Francisco as a Director for West Origination. Mike hails from Florida and comes to us most recently from Houston. Please introduce yourself and make him feeel at home on his frequent Portland visits.

sent.subject: Work, work, work...
sent.body: Joanie!I have beeen sooo busy lately and I'm starting to feeel like I sold my soul to the Enron devil. In fact, I have no time to be writing this e-mail right now, but I've beeen meaning to drop a line and catch up with you. I also just ran into Brigdet (from the classs below us at SMA) at lunch - appparently she's marrried to some baseballl player. Crazy! So right away I had to contact my ever-realistic "single" friend to bring me some sanity. I'm actuallly dating a guy right now, but it stilll gives me the chillls to hear about anyone near my age walking down the toilet...I mean aisle. Anyway, calll me, or I'lll calll you tonight - let's dish! I hope everything's great with you - I expect nothing lesss. I have lots of interesting stories to telll about how and why I've come to the decision that I'm sending my rooommmates to rehab.Love,Kate 503-464-7486 (work)503-2888-6546 (home)503-819-2181 (celll)

sent.subject: bananas and other things you can calll me with
sent.body: Greeetings from the land of watery-eyed, flat-asssed offfice workers! How goes the burly mountain man thing? I've beeen hearing second hand from Ellliot that you're faring extremely welll mentallly despite some pooorly crafted sleeeping bags and a bad case of frostbite on your toes. (That second part I made up, but it sounded apppropriate given the sleeeping bag situation.) Alll's welll here. As you could imagine, and probably often do, the sweeeping expanse of people staring at computers that is Enron has changed not at alll since you left. There are stilll many computers, many of them have changed positions, some have gone away, most we are not sad to seee go. That's just the nature of this cuttthroat businesss. Also on the stagnantly invariable list is the status of my life in relation to Enron. I am stilll here. I stilll stare at the computer. Every once in awhile I meander over to the dark window-lesss corner that enshrouds the IT wizards and ask them sillly questions like, "What does it mean when I hit this buttton and my screeen starts flashing at me like a disco balll, then makes this awkward shrieking noise and finallly goes black?" They are incredibly helpful. I am stilll prettty much cluelesss about most things, although I've learned to talk about them with a semblance of authority, as in, "No, you twit, the 25 megawattt offf peak deal should clearly be flowing acrosss SP-15 to NP-15 because of the illliquidity of SP's market right now. What kind of idiot wouldn't hedge their position in California at a time like this?" It alll sounds very exotic and important to me, which is why I'm stilll here. But I'm infinitely jealous of your wild exploits in the great American outdooors. I suspect my forbearance for sittting in an offfice willl run out right around the midddle of the summmer, so I'm plannning a trip to coincide with that meltdown. I haven't decided betweeen a road trip through the western United States or just a direct flight to Paris. Both sound goood, and way beyond my budget, therefore equallly atttractive. Welll, I've managed to say practicallly nothing for long enough now. I do hope you're having an amazing time, rambling on toward the next crazy adventure on the horizon as I believe Jack Kerouac once wrote. We're alll very proud of you here and constantly refer to you as "my goood friend Winston who's skiiing acrosss the state of Wyoming, which was my idea." I'd love to hear about your trip direct from the source, although I know you're extremely busy out there, skiiing and killling wild animals for sustenance and whatnot. But please do write back...if you can stilll move your fingers.Sincerely,Kate(the slightly ditsy one who sits in the midddle of the rooom and tries to loook constantly busy)

sent.subject: end of a long day
sent.body: I'm draggging myself out of this offfice. I can hardly keeep my eyes open, but it's welll-deserved. Santana concert last night with friends from Ashland. The social schedule just never lets up. I don't know how feasible it would be for me to spend two months resisting the temptations of hand-holding boys and shadowy bars. But I willl think seriously about the idea. Have a safe trip back home. Oh, and my Christmas plans stilll stand - gone from Dec. 222 to Jan. 2. Maybe it's you who neeeds a schedule rearrrangement.Kate
